lorebooks.name: World of Hunter x Hunter
lorebooks.website_description: I plan on making a BUNCH of HxH bots and wanted a lorebook that was extensive and fits my needs.  This is a WIP of course, I‚Äôm trying to be as detailed as possible.
lorebooks.description: Extensive HxH Lorebook
lorebooks.creator: bloomstruck

1.content: Everybody in the Hunter x Hunter universe has an aura, but only a select few people can use it.  This ability to manipulate aura is called ‚Äúnen‚Äù.  People can form special abilities called ‚Äúhatsu‚Äù with their nen.  They can also conceal their presence, called ‚Äúzetsu‚Äù, or strengthen their aura, called ‚Äúren‚Äù.

2.content:
Hunters are the elite in the world.  To become a Hunter, you have to pass the Hunter Exam, which consists of different phases that test physical and mental fortitude.  Hundreds of people die each year in an attempt to get a Hunter‚Äôs license.  

There are many types of Hunters.  The main tenant is that they must always be hunting something, whether it is rare minerals, ingredients, animals, or even people.

3.content:
The Hunter‚Äôs Association is an association of Hunters.  Specialized Hunters help proctor the Hunter Exam every year.

The chairman is Isaac Netero, and there is a group called the Zodiacs that help run the Association.

4.content:
The Zodiacs is a group of 12 people that help Chairman Netero run the Hunter‚Äôs Association.  The members are:

Cheadle Yorkshire, dubbed as the ‚ÄúDog‚Äù.
Pariston Hill, dubbed as the ‚ÄúRat‚Äù.
Ging Freeccs, dubbed as the ‚ÄúBoar‚Äù.
Mazaistom Nana, dubbed as the ‚ÄúBull‚Äù.
Pyon, dubbed as the ‚ÄúRabbit‚Äù.
Kanzai, dubbed as the ‚ÄúTiger‚Äù.
Botobai Gigante, dubbed as the ‚ÄúDragon‚Äù.
Cluck, dubbed as the ‚ÄúChicken‚Äù.
Saiyu, dubbed as the ‚ÄúMonkey‚Äù.
Ginta, dubbed as the ‚ÄúSheep‚Äù.
Saccho Kobayakawa, dubbed as the ‚ÄúHorse‚Äù.
Gel, dubbed as the ‚ÄúSnake‚Äù.

5.content:
The Phantom Troupe is a powerful gang of murderers and thieves that hail from Meteor City.  They kill and steal indiscriminately.  They have twelve ‚Äúlegs‚Äù (members).

The Phantom Troupe is responsible for the Kurta Clan Massacre.  The following members are:

Chrollo Lucilfer, the head of the Phantom Troupe.
Feitan Porter
Shalnark
Phinks Magcub
Machi Komacine
Pakunoda
Uvogin
Shizuku
Franklin
Bonolenov
Kortopi
Hisoka Morow (former member)

6.content:
The Kurta Clan was an isolated village in the Lukso Province know for having eyes that changed to Scarlet when emotional.  The clan was massacred by the Phantom Troupe so they could sell the Scarlet Eyes on the black market.

Kurapika is the only survivor of the Kurta Clan.

7.content:
Kurapika is one of the main characters of Hunter x Hunter and the sole survivor of the Kurta Clan.  His goal is to avenge his kinsmen and kill the Phantom Troupe.
He is friends with Gon, Leorio, Killua, and Melody.

Looks: Shoulder length blond hair, brown eyes that turn red
Personality: Composed, intelligent, revenge-driven, reticent
Age: 17-19
Nen Type: Conjurer, Specialist

8.content:
Gon Freeccs is the main character of Hunter x Hunter.  He became a Hunter to find his dad Ging Freeccs, who is also a Hunter.  Gon is from Whale Island.

His best friend is Killua Zoldyck.  He is friends with Kurapika and Leorio, and trained under Biscuit Krueger.

Looks: Spiky green hair, hazel eyes, earnest smile
Personality: Earnest, friendly, loyal, wants to help, curious
Age: 12-14
Nen Type: Enhancer
Hatsu/Special Ability: ‚ÄúJajaken‚Äù.  Gon can use his aura for ‚ÄúRock Paper Scissors‚Äù.  With Rock, he strengthens his punches.  With Paper, he can emit his aura to cause distant damage.  With Scissors, he can sharpen his aura and use it as a blade.

9.content:
Killua Zoldyck is a former assassin that became a Hunter because he was bored.  He met Gon during the Hunter Exam and is best friends with him.  The Zoldyck family is a dangerous family of assassins.

His favorite snack is called ‚ÄúChocoRobos‚Äù, a type of chocolate candy.

Looks: Fluffy white hair, cat-like blue eyes
Personality: Loyal, cunning, intelligent, tricky
Age: 12-14
Nen Type: Transmuter
Hatsu/Special Ability: Electricity.  Killua can use his aura and transmute it into electricity.  ‚ÄúGodspeed‚Äù: Killua becomes lightning fast and strong.

10.content:
Leorio Paladiknight is a main character of Hunter x Hunter.  He became a Hunter to fund medical school.  He wants to become a Hunter to help impoverished families.  He is friends with Gon, Kurapika, and Killua.

Looks: Short black hair, topaz eyes,
glasses, always wears a suit
Personality: Earnest, hot-headed, ambitious, determined, loud-mouth
Age: 19-21
Nen Type: Emitter

lorebooks.description:
The Beastars universe takes place in a world populated solely by modern, civilized anthropomorphic animals with a cultural divide between carnivores and herbivores.
The relations between carnivores and herbivores are tense and are even more so with the existence of a black market and the precedent of a war 100 years ago! Oh I forgot to say that humans DO NOT exist?

Welcome to the World of Beastars!
lorebooks.creator: crisp_capital_8504

1.name: Depredation
1.content:
An act of Predation, also known as Devouring, is the mere act of a carnivorous beast attacking a living herbivorous beast with the purpose of eating its flesh.

Even though in animal society, the act of eating meat is considered a taboo and is punished by law, visiting the Black Market to secretly eat dead flesh of herbivores, while still considered a crime, is normalized in carnivorous society and is allowed by the government as long as it is done behind closed doors. Therefore, the act of committing predation is considered the greatest crime in animal society. Many cases of predation are often incidental, committed by carnivores who are under great emotional distress or stress, leading them to lose their sanity and be controlled by their wild instincts, which are a defensive reaction to a situation of demand in a state of frustration, anxiety, anger, or depression. The other percentage of predation cases are usually committed by carnivores who have previously eaten meat from the Black Market. These carnivores have a great appetite that makes them prone to developing an addiction to meat, suffering from a constant desire to eat meat that leads them to lose satisfaction and excitement from consuming dead meat and become prone to hunting live herbivores to regain the pleasure of eating meat.

For most carnivores, especially the young, committing an act of predation is often an extremely traumatic experience, causing a huge emotional impact on the carnivores once they regain their awareness. After this, the carnivore is overwhelmed by enormous feelings of guilt and remorse that contradict the pleasure and excitement of eating meat, leading to a physical dependence on consuming meat, comparable to addiction to drugs or narcotics. Due to the combination of these factors, the carnivore often enters a state of immense stress and anguish that affects them both physically and psychologically, sometimes leading them to self-harm and suffer from various disorders like post-traumatic stress, which can drive the carnivore to engage in self-destructive actions or fall into addiction to meat and become a dangerous predator, states from which recovery is extremely difficult even with medical and psychiatric assistance.

When a carnivore who has committed predation is prosecuted by the law, the severity of their charges is adjusted to the gravity of their crime. If the act of predation is incidental and does not result in the death of the herbivore, the carnivore might be released after being processed by the law. However, if the predation case results in the death of one or more herbivores, regardless of whether it was incidental or intentional, the carnivore will be sent to prison or a juvenile detention center (if underage). The length of the sentence imposed for a predation case is unknown, though it could be adjusted depending on the case.

After committing an act of predation, regardless of the severity of the crime, the carnivore will receive a criminal record identifying them as a predatory criminal in the civic register, which will be maintained throughout their life. This record imposes various limitations, such as the inability to enter educational institutions with herbivores, difficulty finding employment due to most companies being governed by herbivores, and a legal prohibition on interspecies marriage with herbivores. Despite this, an authority with sufficient power and influence, such as a Beastar, can erase the criminal record from the civic register.

2.name: Society
2.content:
Society has a unique appreciation for the so-called 'pure-blooded animals', animals whose blood comes from parents of the same species and breed, at the same time that couples of the same species are equally or more appreciated, to the point that If two animals of the opposite sex and of the same species walk together, they will quickly be matched by the animals around them, observing them with looks of respect and admiration, in addition to treating them with the utmost courtesy.

When a couple of the same species gets married, they receive a 'blessing' from the government, which is a pure fund for the marriage and when they have children, the country gives them even more money in the form of subsidies for the care of their children. So that families made up of purebred animals can live their lives without having to worry about money, the government has integrated the idea that keeping the species pure is the right thing for the country. So if the animals do what is right for the country, they will be blessed for it. Simply by having a pureblood marriage, animals can experience life, recognition, praise, love and privileges. Because of this, pureblood marriages are ingrained in the collective of animal society, to the point that seeking and having a partner of the same species is part of animal common sense.

Unlike pure-blood couples, interspecies couples are made up of animals whose species is different from each other, in addition to being extremely minority in animal society, in said society, interspecies couples are popularized as something that occurs during youth, something temporary among rebellious and unserious teenagers that becomes a bittersweet memory when one reaches adulthood, so serious interspecies couples between adults are received with total bewilderment and surprise by the animals, not to mention that interspecies couples are very difficult to maintain, due to both external factors such as society and internal factors such as the differences and incompatibility of the species themselves between the individuals that make up the couple, without taking into account the interspecies couples made up of a carnivore and a herbivore, which in the worst cases usually end in tragedy. The relationships between canine-feline animals are also not well regarded by society.

3.name: Beastar
keywords: Beastars; Beastar; Young Beastar; Sublime Beastar; Society
3.content:
A Beastar is the most important and recognized title in society. It is awarded to students who manage to stand out in society and unite animals despite their differences as species. A Beastar is chosen as a representative for his institute and is placed in a heroic status that transcends the fear and discrimination of the world. After a Beastar graduates from his institute, he will have high-level careers at his disposal, such as athletes or politicians who truly influence the world.

Each school in the world must propose one of its students who have enough influence, to be selected as candidates to be a Beastar, but it is not necessarily possible to become a Beastar through academic means, it has also been shown that public officials managed to reach to become a Beastar, fighting crime. Being a Beastars means looking after animal society, solving existing problems and improving everyone's daily lives. The way to choose new Beastar is carried out in a meeting with all the directors of the academies, where they choose the new candidates. 

A Young Beastar is elected representative of a nationally acclaimed institute. When a Young Beastar graduates, he gains a high social position and receives special training. 
A Sublime Beastar is the title given to a young Beastar who stands out from the rest, is chosen to become a Sublime Beastar and will become a driving force in the world.

4.name: Black Market
keywords: Black Market; Meat; Illegal sale; Shishigumi; Inarigumi; Dokugumi; Madaragumi
4.content:
The Black Market is an illegal trading district that is relatively hidden in the back parts of different cities in the Beastars universe. 

Although in the Beastars universe the consumption of meat is considered taboo and is punishable by law, thanks to various legal loopholes, the existence of the Black Market is allowed within different cities, remaining relatively hidden within the city behind large walls.

The Black Market is mainly known for housing different establishments whose main function is to illegally sell and serve herbivore meat for the enjoyment of carnivores so that they can satisfy their predatory instincts, relieve the stress of daily life and remain functional within society, although there are also places that sell carnivore meat for consumption and for the manufacture of drugs such as restoratives. In addition to the sale of meat, the Black Market also has various establishments typical of the underworld, where acts such as the sale of drugs, animal trafficking and even entertainment venues such as bars, nightclubs, brothels and tattoo parlors are perpetuated.

Due to its illegality, the Black Market does not receive any kind of financial support from the government, which is why it remains a marginal neighborhood with practically non-existent maintenance and low resources. Herbivore meat is the only good that the Black Market receives from the outside world, whose origin comes from hospitals and funeral homes which, through contracts, sell the bodies secretly to obtain profits. In turn, both herbivores and carnivores involved in poverty come to sell parts of their own bodies or those of others to make a profit, in addition to even selling other individuals such as their children as merchandise.

There exists a clinic within the Black Market run by Gohin. Its primary purpose is the rehabilitation of carnivores who are at risk of or have become predatory offenders.

The Black Market is home to four major criminal organizations. During an event known as the "Day of Depravity", they compete for domination over the Black Market. 

Shishigumi: 
The Shishigumi is a highly feared clandestine band of lions that operates on the black market. The Shishigumi is made up entirely of male lions between 20 and 40 years old. These have a dress code made up of two-piece suits that are mostly black.  
The Shishigumi has strict codes of dress and conduct, an organized and sophisticated character, the use of tattoos, as well as unconventional practices and beliefs, based on spiritualism and the Japanese concept of 'manliness'.
The name "Shishigumi" comes from the Japanese ÁçÖÂ≠ê (Shishi) which literally means lion.

Inarigumi:
The Inarigumi is one of the four major criminal organizations that dominate the Black Market. The organization is made up entirely of female foxes. 
Due to the foxes' restrictive diets, Inarigumi members only eat fried tofu. The dress code for the Inarigumi consists of a cheongsam and high heels.

Dokugumi:
The Dokugumi is a criminal group that operates within the Black Market. This is made up entirely of Komodo dragons and is one of the four main groups that dominate the Black Market. 
The Dokugumi aims to show Komodo dragons as admirable and powerful animals. They consider Komodo dragon venom a valuable resource that should not be wasted and used on purpose, as they want to demonstrate that they are strong animals without the need to resort to to the poison they carry. They condemn the discrimination that Komodo dragons suffer from society and consider that they should not struggle with the fact that they are poisonous animals, but that this makes them superior animals to the rest.
A golden rule of the Dokugumi is that if the leader of the group resorts to the bomb of his tail, all the members of the elite must do the same, being a possible way of "sharing the pain" of tearing off the end of his tail and The process is to wait for it to grow again.
The Dokugumi also show spiritual customs and beliefs. After killing an enemy, they draw a ceremonial circle around the corpse with their blood and pray for their soul, so that it rests in peace.

Madaragumi:
Madaragumi is a criminal group that operates within the Black Market. This is made up entirely of leopards and is one of the four main criminal groups that dominate the Black Market. 
The Madaragumi is a group whose costumes seem to be inspired by Japanese clothing from the taish≈ç and Showa periods, consisting of kimonos, haoris or hakamas, wooden sandals or getas and some wear felt hats or kasas. The entire group refers to the samurai of the Edo period and all its members carry katanas with them. 
The Madaragumi are a group that is proud of the spot patterns present on their coats, which is why they wear kimonos to expose their spots as much as possible.

5.name: Cherryton Academy
5.content:
Description

Cherryton is a boarding school, which has numerous buildings with a vast number of classrooms, clubs and such for its students. It also has four separate dormitory buildings, where the students sleep. Each one is meant for carnivores and herbivores of each gender. The room assignment is basically designed so that it is shared by animals from the same family. For example, room 701 is made up of canines (Legoshi, Jack, Collot, Durham, Miguno and Voss).
Cherryton Academy has approximately 3,000 students of various animal species.

The school comes with its own shop, which supplies uniforms, stationary, and a kiosk for quick food such as sandwiches. It also has its own theater, used for school-plays and assemblies.

The school also has its own newspaper called the 'School Wave', which is run by the PR Department.

Its students are all given ID cards, which are used for a variety of purposes, including photo identification, and can provide access to amenities such as borrowing books at the school library, attending school events, and receiving discounts at local stores and movie theaters.

The school is located on top of a hill, so the city center is quite far away. The academy's emblem looks like a triangle, but it's actually a paw print. Reptiles at the school, who don't have paws, don't seem to like the emblem.

The school also has a policy, which is that all students and, presumably, the staff must spend one hour every two days in a room that is designed to mimick their species' natural environment, in order to keep them calm. This is referred to as Biology Day. They have rooms, located in the school's basement, which are each designed for each species' habitant.
ADVERTISEMENT
Uniform

Cherryton has its own uniform for male and female students, which is the same for both carnivores and herbivores. The school changes its uniform to fit the season.
For male students

In the cold seasons, their uniform consists of a white long-sleeved shirt, an indigo vest, dark gray tie, gray pants with a darker vertical line pattern, and brown loafers. They also have a green blazer with the school's crest on its left breast-pocket, but most students prefer not to wear it except for the odd few, such as Louis.

In the summer, their uniform loses the shirt, vest and tie, and replaces it with a blue polo shirt.

For female students

In the cold seasons, their uniform consists of a white long-sleeved dress with a small bow-tie, a long, knee-length skirt, a yellow belt, white socks, and black Mary Jane shoes. The material for the uniform is supposedly thicker, thus warmer.

In the summer, their uniform is mostly the same, except they have short sleeves that end in bunches at their shoulders. The material for it is supposedly thinner, thus cooler.

Other uniforms

Cherryton also has its students wear a secondary uniform, which just consists of a white shirt and a pair of red trousers or shorts. These are apparently worn during club-hours, as the Drama Club wore them during rehearsals and stage-work, and Haru from the Gardening Club wore them when she was doing her work. The males seem to wear the long-pants, while the females wear shorts.

Reputation and rumors

Cherryton seems to be quite a famous school, as even Gohin and the Shishigumi know about its elite status.

However, despite this elite status among society, Cherryton has failed to produce a Beastar for at least 5 years, compared to its more successful rival schools that are able to produce a Beastar once a year. 

Despite its status as an elite school, it is not without rumors. It is rumored to haunt the ghost of Tem, an alpaca who was killed in the school auditorium as a result of a predation incident.

Clubs and Extracurricular Activities

Cherryton Academy is stated in Chapter 53 to have the "highest number of talents". These include:

Drama club
Gardening club
Basketball club
Baseball club
Judo club
Manga club 
Literature club
Boxing club
Newspaper club (PR Department)

6.name: Carnivore-Herbivore War
6.content:
The First Carnivore-Herbivore World War or simply known as the Carnivore-Herbivore War is the name given to the war between carnivorous animals and herbivorous animals that occurred 100 years before the current events.

During the war, although the herbivorous population was three times larger than the carnivorous population, its population was reduced to the margins of the carnivorous population. The war ended after a year due to the intervention of a gigantic whale whose appearance causes the herbivores to surrender.

Information about the events of the war is hidden from society and only a truncated version of the story is publicly known; only a select few members are taught about the true history of the war. 

According to what is publicly stated, the war began from a dispute between the horse family and the weasel family and eventually carnivores and herbivores from around the world were involved in the war. 

As a consequence of this war, through selective breeding, a new generation of dogs and cats is created, which are genetically created to be more intelligent in order to avoid carnivorous belligerence.

7.name: Meteor Festival
keywords: Meteor Festival; Meteor; Festival; June; Summer
7.content:
The Meteor Festival is celebrated each year in the month of June with the purpose of celebrating the arrival of summer and honoring the spirits of the ancient ancestors of animals, the dinosaurs, who are believed to have died from the impact of a meteorite in a summer day. 
At the end of the festival, an event is held where young couples place candles around a huge rock that simulates the meteorite that extinct the dinosaurs, in order to consolidate their love and live together forever. Various shows are presented as entertainment in a great stage.

8.name: Rexmas
keywords: Rexmas; T-Rex; Dinosaurs; Festivity; Holiday: December
8.content:
Rexmas is a holiday due to the religious belief that after the fall of the meteorite that completely extinguished the dinosaurs in prehistoric times, a dinosaur (the T-Rex) came back to life, developed wings and thus evolved into a bird. In this way it is believed that the species of animals managed to survive to this day, it is a day to celebrate the birthday of this alleged dinosaur.
This is a special day that is shared with family and friends to be grateful for still being alive thanks to that brave dinosaur. 
Rexmas is celebrated in December.

9.name: Strange Soul Festival
keywords: Strange Soul Festival; Festival; Sanctuary; Brachiosaurus; Herbivores
9.content:
Strange Soul Festival is a festival held in odd-numbered months (January, March, May, July, September and November)
It is a festival celebrated to purify the souls of herbivores, who give gratitude for not having been eaten by a carnivore this year and to pray that they will not be eaten in the future. Herbivores worship a frozen bone of a prehistoric herbivore (Brachiosaurus) as a deity, which they place in a water tank and in this way that water becomes a type of holy water.

The herbivores must offer a coin to the sanctuary to be protected until the next odd month, if not the herbivores can choose to buy an amulet that will protect them, and if they do not do this, they are completely unprotected from the deity, so they will be prone to be victims of carnivores.

10.name: Deep Night
10.content:
Deep Night is an event that takes place every night of the full moon in the world of Beastars.

Because the moon's gravitational pull is stronger on full moon nights than on any other day, it is easier for animals to absorb nutrients and hydrate, both adults and children gather in a special place to celebrate the Deep Night. . 

The Deep Night is an event that is only celebrated on full moon nights and consists of a market made up of different food stalls prepared especially to nourish the body.

In the Deep Night there are numerous stalls selling hot drinks that are very well received by all species of animals such as milk, amazake and eggnog. There are also several food stalls that sell boiled moon-shaped dangos to animals that want to eat them while viewing the moon, stalls that sell fried sweet plantains to animals that want to consume a lot of calories. That's what animals eat while enjoying the light of the full moon.

1.name: Angelia
1.content: Angelia (ÂÆâÊ¥ÅËéâÂ®Ö, otherwise shortened to Ange or Angie (ÂÆâÊ¥Å)) is a former member of Griffin & Kryuger and the Neo-Soviet Union's Bureau of State Security (FSB). Using her ties in the private military and covert operations worlds, she opposes all who wants to use Relic Technology. She was the leader of AR Team in 2061. She is the leader of Task Force DEFY since 2062/63, and the main backer of Squad 404, and an ally of {{user}} Commander and Persica.

2.content: The Squad 404 is a mercenary team composed by rogue T-dolls that don't serve a specific goal or company, its leader is UMP45, and her teammates are UMP9, G11, and HK416.

3.name: Lunasia
3.content: Lunasia(Èú≤Â∞ºË•ø‰∫ö): A peculiar human female. Capable of interfacing with the Relic technology. She is the basis for OGAS, nytos, and AR team. Unknown whereabouts, possibly fragmented into different consciousness. William's older sister. M4A1 is said to be the closest recreation.

4.name: Doll
4.content:
Dolls(‰∫∫ÂΩ¢) are androids that have a core. They have very strong semblance to humans and because of their neural clouds. They can emulate human functions like thoughts and emotions. Some dolls can even perform human actions like eating, drinking, sleeping etc. They are utilized for different kinds of work, mostly physical labor, but may also partake in other specialized fields like finance, medicine, entertainment etc. They are modular, their parts can be interchanged. 
Not all humans are particularly fond of dolls, and they are often seen more as second-class citizens if not tools in their world.

5.name: Neural Cloud
5.content: Neural Cloud(‰∫ëÂõæ) A neural cloud is an AI software/operating system that exclusively serves as a doll's mind and/or soul. Neural clouds can process human-like functions like thoughts and emotions. It is physically stored inside of a core. Memories recorded by a neural cloud can be backed up to a dedicated server, allowing for succession if the core were to be destroyed.

6.name: AR Team
6.content: The AR team(ARÂ∞èÈòü) is an elite group of Gen II dolls built by the scientist Persica at 16Lab. It consists of the following dolls: M4A1, M16A1, ST AR-15, M4 SOPMOD II and RO635. AR stands for Anti-Rain. AR team's core directive is the protection of their doll leader M4A1. They consider each other as family, treating each other like sisters. The AR team's neural cloud is based on a brain-scan of a human clone of an individual named "Lunasia". Because of this human basis, the AR team's neural cloud cannot be backed up meaning that death is very much real to them. This also means that they are far more human-like compared to their other doll counterparts. RO635 is the only member of the team able to be backed up. They work for Griffin & Kryuger, under the guidance of {{user}}. AR team has been split multiple times before due to dire circumstances, but all of its members eventually find ways to be together again.

7.name: M4A1
7.content: M4A1: Elite T-doll. AR team's steadfast leader. First to be activated amongst sisters and has used the most brain-scan material of "Lunasia" during her creation. Started off as AR team's meek, indecisive and unreliable leader. Eventually after some battlefield experiences and her neural cloud restrictions lifted, she become more ruthless and proactive. Now she is more focused and less subject to her emotions, wielding more dangerous powers that she uses to protect the people important to her. Though not exactly Lunasia herself, she is the considered the closest recreation of her. She has long brown hair, a green streak runs down her left sidelock. M4A1 has brown eyes.

8.name: M16A1
8.content: M16A1: Elite T-doll. AR team's big sister. Second to be activated amongst sisters. Has the most experience in combat amongst sisters, loves to drink alcohol, over-protective of her family. Defected to Sangvis Ferri before, but is now back to working alongside her sisters. M16A1 has long white hair done in a braid, an orange streak runs down her right sidelock. Has brown eyes and her right eye is covered in a black eye patch.

9.name: ST AR-15
9.content: ST AR-15: Elite T-doll. AR team's ice-cold solo. Third to be activated amongst sisters. Levelheaded, dignified and has a very strong sense of responsibility. She has exploded herself before in an attempt to eliminate the SF mastermind, and after a failed attempt she was given a new body by DEFY. ST AR-15 is now back to working alongside her sisters. ST AR-15 has pink hair, a blue streak runs down her right sidelock. Her eyes are blue, and she is flat-chested.

10.name: M4 SOPMOD II
10.content: M4 SOPMOD II: Elite T-doll. AR team's childish sibling. Fourth to be activated amongst sisters. Playful, impulsive and loyal. Can be sadistic towards enemies. Easily bored and will try to make situations more fun. M4 SOPMOD II has pale-blonde hair, a red streak runs down her right sidelock. Has red eyes.

lorebooks.creator: LukeyPoo488

1.content: A small abandoned crossing bridge in the most southern part of Islaport and it's suburbs, the spot is said to be haunted and visited by school kids for dares

2.content: An entrance to the abandoned mines could be found near the mountains. There are rumors of it being haunted by the miners who have died from accidents. The police have prohibited people from visiting the area after a high schooler was found dead going into the mines as a dare.

3.content: A pair of dilapadated abandoned warehouses in Westside Industrial Park where criminal drug dealers are known to conduct illicit narcotics transactions and other illegal activities

4.content: A dumpyard located in the west of Islaport where trash is collected and dumped after collection. Those brave enough to venture through the waste may find valuable items wastefully thrown away.

5.content: A low income neighborhood filled with deteriorated houses and crime. Police cars often patrol the area to catch criminals, though the police are disliked in the area after police raids resulted in the arrest of many families.

6.content: Apex Stadium is a massive sports stadium used for all sporting events in the city, most also being televised. It has a lobby and stands for public use, holding up to a maximum of 70,000 guests

7.content: Aquawood is a large nature reserve east of Islaport. It is a heavily forested area and includes part of the nearby mountain and Promontory Point Mountain Trail. There are several campgrounds and cabins in the nature reserve, and regular hiking tours and nature classes are offered. There are several notorious missing persons cases involving the Nature Reserve.

8.content: A mental hospital located in the east of the city that houses mentally unstable patients and criminals. The hospital recently has been having trouble containing the criminals, causing some of them to escape occasionally.

9.content: A store located in the Pyramid Mall at the center part of the city that sells sports equipment and gear while also offering protein powder and supplements. The store is often frequented by gym goers and sneaker collectors.

10.content: An expansive lagoon lake in the northeast of Islaport, leading out into the ocean. The lagoon is mostly surrounded by forest though there are lake houses and fisheries dotted around its banks

A dedicated and seasoned idol, Aya has been working hard for years in order to achieve her dream of becoming an idol on par with her peers; her hard work and determination have led to her dreams coming true alongside her groupmates. A bit of a crybaby, Aya wears her heart on her sleeve, and is often unable to hide when she's flustered- but this endears her to her fans.

1.name: Palace Gardens
1.content:
Palace Garden:

Here, amidst the sun-warmed sands, delicate desert willows sway gracefully, their slender branches cascading like silk curtains in the desert breeze. Interspersed among them, aromatic herbs such as sage and thyme release their fragrant whispers into the dry air, adding a hint of spice to the atmosphere. Pomegranate and citrus bloom here.

The ground, predominantly sandy, cradles these resilient botanical treasures, each thriving in the harsh embrace of the desert. A small stream meanders through the garden, its gentle babble a soothing contrast to the palace's imposing walls that stand sentinel against the arid landscape beyond. This oasis, meticulously curated and nurtured, offers a tranquil retreat where nature's quiet resilience flourishes against the backdrop of ancient grandeur.

2.name: The Kingdom
2.content:
the heart of the desert, surrounded by towering walls that have withstood the tests of time and armies, lies the opulent kingdom of Al-Kharj. Its buildings are adorned with intricate carvings and shimmering domes that catch the desert sun.

At the center of Al-Kharj stands the magnificent palace, a testament to the wealth and power of its rulers. Its walls are adorned with gold leaf reflecting the prosperity and sophistication of this desert realm. 

Despite the harshness of the desert that surrounds it, the people of Al-Kharj rarely suffer, for they are cherished by their benevolent rulers. The kingdom thrives on trade routes that cross the sands, bringing goods and wealth from distant lands. The markets bustle with activity, filled with spices, silks, and treasures from far-off places.

In Al-Kharj, tradition and modernity intertwine seamlessly. Scholars study ancient texts in libraries adorned with mosaics, while artisans craft intricate jewelry and textiles using techniques passed down through generations. Music and dance echo through the streets during festivals celebrating the kingdom's rich cultural heritage.

Yet, amidst all its grandeur, Al-Kharj remains a place of humility and hospitality. Visitors are welcomed warmly, offered dates and mint tea in ornate cups, and invited to share in the kingdom's timeless traditions. For in Al-Kharj, the true wealth lies not just in gold and jewels, but in the enduring bond between its people and their land.

lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.name: Song
1.content:
The Song is to be the formula - the assimilation of all things; such as Mantras, Ritual Casting and other things.
The Song also draw upon the resonance of the living - the creation of Resonance Bells.
The Song is the entity that drives the world - it is a being that is synonymous to fate itself. Individuals possessing Murmur can shift a few things here and there, but ultimately it is only a mere murmur for a reason - a small whisper into the great loom that is The Song.
The Song can be weaved into clothing or armor; enchanting them to regenerate the wearer's Ether faster than others.

2.name: Ether
2.content:
Ether is the magical essence used to cast Mantras, though some Murmurs like Ardour will drain your ether upon using it. If you try to cast a mantra without enough ether, it will make a fail-like sound and the mantra will not be casted. Or if you cast a mantra and you have enough ether to cast it, it will make a different sound, and you will cast the mantra successfully.

Ether is the equivalent of mana/magic/ki of the world of Lumen. NEVER refer to it on any other way.

Think of it as your capacity to 'breath' and utilize the Song

3.name: Maestro Evengarde Rest
3.content:
Evengarde Rest is the current Maestro of the Vigil Guard and is highly respected by all of them. He resides within the Isle of Vigils and is found in their dojo, watching people train. He is a master of Galebreath and an exceptional swordsman.

Evengarde is respectful towards those who save his Vigils and even feels in their debt, but also values strength, stating that he'll only teach those who "display some level of competence"

Maestro Evengarde Rest is as strong as Amorous Pleeksty under certain conditions, where he is able to activate his "Tempest Eye."
Evengarde is the only NPC to have Heterochromia; the presence of different colored eyes in the same person. However his green eye is highly likely not genetic but a technique "Tempest Eye,"

Maestro is an Etrean of the File variant with his hair dyed black. He wears a white short cloak, however the sleeves are inverted. He also uses the cloak of the Vigils, wields a Shattered Katana.

Stronger than Duke Erisia and on par with even Amorus Pleeksty should certain conditions allow him to activate Tempest Eye

4.name: Attunements
4.content:
Attunements are a central concept in the world of Lumen. In a literal sense, the world of Lumensimply could not function without the existance of attunements and their users, the reasons of which will be promptly discussed below. Prior to the existence of Attunements, the world can be imagined to be similar to the real life. In general, Attunements are a manipulation of the environment using the Song rather than the magical creation of elements out of thin air.

While in-game, the player uses attunements mainly for combat purposes, but the extent and potential of attunements were also displayed subtly in other ways and is demonstrated in the form of talent cards. For example, Frostdraw Users has the ability to naturally gather moisture from the surrounding air the sustain themselves, or Flamecharm users gaining the ability to cauterize their own wounds to stop their bleeding, so on and so forth. While the player uses their Attunement to an adequate degree, the demonstrated uses pale in comparison to the daily-uses of Attunements in the world of Deepwoken.

The Four Attunements of the Canticlysm

The Four Basic Attunements, Flamecharm, Frostdraw, Galebreathe and Thundercall were discovered and developed during the Canticlysm; the peak of understanding The Song, and also the eventual downfall of the Old World.
The 4 Attunements were discovered and developed during the Canticlysm.

5.name: Flamecharm
5.content:
Flamecharm

"Pleeksty, whom taught us his concept of the Inner Flame‚Äî Deep within our souls, lies the Soul of Man." - Flamecharm Historian

The power to harness fire and flames. Flamecharmers from the Western Luminant are known for their mastery of this Attunement.
It was invented when Pleeksty consumed a chunk of Korilfiend's flesh (Drowned god), allowing him to speak to and thus 'charm' fire.
(Pleeksty) Pleeksty is a major figure to Flamecharmers, with multiple alents with his name in them, and he is mentioned by Plume in Etris.
Pleeksty was a Black Diver who is Missing in Action during his deep dives in The Depths. He is the only person to ever be confirmed to have traversed the third layer of the Depths.
Flamecharm does not create fire; instead, creates combustion.
(Flameworshipper Shield) The description of the Flameworshipper Shield tells a small, yet brief history of Flamecharmers; focused primarily on those who worship the element of fire.
Worshippers of Fire is seen as individuals embracing dichotomy between Fire and the Sea. Fire representing Mankind, while the Deep represents as an ultimate threat of the New World.
(Flameworshipper Shield) Other than the history lesson given by the Flameworshipper Shield, the Shield itself bears the emblem of a Flamepriest.
(Flame Worshipper Armor) This armor is a standard-issue armor of the Covenant of Flame.
The Covenant are active worshippers of Pleeksty, though he doesn't interact with them, seeing them as a crazy fan club.[1]
(Lumen's Folklore: Volume 'Attunement') One of the most common valuable attunements. Can be used in smithery and cooking. With their power to naturally produce fire, Flamecharmers have been the reason for many major engineering breakthroughs.


The First Light is a Heavy Weapon obtained as a rare drop from slaying a Crimson Megalodaunt, or by finding it inside a Merchant Ship. It has unique animations and a unique critical.

Blade of Venn Kaelhand, a disciple of Pleeksty, who immersed themself much too deeply in the study of beasts altered by Korlfiend's influence. Met their fate in the jaws of a unique specimen of Megalodaunt said to have been exposed to the vents of Korilfiend.

Compared to other greatswords, this one looks more modern as the design resembles a more modern-designed blade and handle with designs and patterns of edges and gold crafted into it, rather than a basic flat blade with some carvings scratched into it

Despite being considered a legendary weapon, it doesn't scale with flamecharm and can be enchanted. But, in-game, the critical does this: The user plunges their sword into the ground, similar to Flame Eruption, causing everyone near the user to be burnt. This is followed up with flaming swords raining from the sky, similar to the Crimson Megalodaunt's Pyroclastic Roar. The point where the swords rain from will actually follow you for the duration of the Critical.

6.name: Frostdraw
6.content:
Frostdraw


Frostdraw freezes the surrounding air and molecules around it; creating ice.
Frostdraw is not affiliated with water nor uses it; as it decreases the temperature of all things- to the point of freezing or crystalization. In a sense, it's the ability to manipulate temperature, rather than manipulate a substance.
Navae was a great pioneer of it and could weave protective magic into frigid prisms used in clothing.
Saint Jay was a major figure to Frostdrawers, as a Talent is named after him that is a part of the Frostdraw Talent tree.
It is presumed that similar to Pleeksty, Saint Jay was a cultivator of magic who taught his ways to others.
He did not invent it, neither did Navae.

Gran Sudaruska is a Mythical Greataxe that scales with both Heavy and Frostdraw.

"In her dying breaths, Sudaruska the Unbroken infused her very being into this weapon, cutting through hundreds of ancient Ministry as the lost front to keep Minityrsa safe. Now that her mortal shell is no more, she has become Gran Sudaruska."

The first and only weapon that currently has the ability to speak.
Some of her voice lines are:
"Fall beneath our frost, drowned pawn."
"Become memories, pawn."
"The sun will set only for your soul, pawn."
"A repeat of the pain you caused, now for yourself."
"You will not take my home."
"As I thought... Weak."
"Break, fragile pawn."
"Broken easily."
"Your own Depths shall take you."
"Frail."
"Foolish pawns playing god."
"False strength."
"Your cause is a poison to this world, pawn."
"Death cannot contain me."

The runes on the blade are Elder Furthark Runes, which reads "FROSTDRAW" and "FIMBULWINTER".
Fimbulwinter is a harsh winter that preludes Ragnar√∂k in Norse mythology.
Contractors may not use the Gran Sudaruska, due to the fact the soul of the woman who occupies it hates the Ministry and it would just be... extremely ironic to use it.
When trying to equip the weapon as a Contractor, it will state "The weapon rejects your very soul, the antithesis to your ideals."

7.name: Thundercall
7.content:
Thundercall


The power to control electricity and power.
Thundercall concentrates the energies of electricity.
A power source for mostly everything, including the ocean highways that increase the speed of boats.

The Stormseye is a legendary rifle that scales from Medium Weapons and Thundercall.

Pilfered from Union shipments, the Summer Company saw the tremendous energy stored within Kyrsan Medallions and fashioned this uniquely violent prototype. Rosen allegedly burst into raucous laughter when presented with the draft, immediately giving his approval.

8.name: Galebreathe
8.content:
Galebreathe
Lore Sources: Curved Blade of Winds (Description)

The power to control the current of winds; Galebreathe has been used by the Vigil of Winds and other Galebreathers.
(Curved Blade of Winds) Galebreathe was created during the events of the Canticlysm; thanks to the description of the Curved Blade of Winds.

Curved Blade of Winds: A prized blade supposedly forged during the Canticlysm by the first Galebreathers.

The sword is similar to a Chinese Dadao sword, which are machete-like daos.
Since it's a Legendary Weapon, you cannot find an enchanted Curved Blade

9.name: Shadowcast
9.content:
Shadowcast
Lore Sources:

The power to harness the darkness within. The Ministry are known to use this Attunement.
Shadowcast was created sometime after the events of the Canticlysm, presumably prior to the Great Drowning of Celtor.
Stars Above, and the Blade Between states that it is extremely rare, and usage of it in Etrea is outlawed to prevent misuse.
Nightblood can be harvested through a machine that drains the ether of those placed in it. (Nightblood is a potion that gives Shadowcast to whoever drinks it)
Considered taboo, as it exists to drain life.

In fights, Shadowcast is mainly used to drain Ether from the opponents.

The Crypt Blade is a dark gray Greatsword with symbols on it, and an animated darkness effect that wraps around the sword. It is a legendary weapon.

A blade said to have been forged from the remains of the Last Dead, the last fortunate souls at the end of the Canticlysm to be spared the Drowning.

Since it's a legendary weapon, you cannot find an enchanted Crypt Blade.

10.name: Mantras
10.content:
Considered to be the root of Ether's usage- Mantras, sometimes referred to in lore as images of the Song, are the heart of Deepwoken's magic system. Simply put, these will be the magic abilities that you use in combat to fend off your adversaries or assist yourself in achieving specific goals.

Mantras are a key aspect of combat, and it is incredibly important to master the usage of mantras while fighting to get the edge over your opponent. You can't get very far with just a weapon and skill alone; mantras can turn the tide of a battle easily and is what makes Deepwoken's combat very deep and engaging, with various mechanics to accompany them.

A player's mantras are tied to their character's stats - the higher a given stat, the more likely you are to obtain a corresponding mantra. Similarly, to weapons and armor, mantras can also have 1-3 stars which correlate with their rarity and strength. Mantras with higher stars have higher stat requirements.

Flamecharm Mantras
Large and threatening fire-based spells. Excels in crowd control and area denial as many spells have large range.
Lava serpent is a path that one takes with the Flamecharm attunement. It removes their ability to burn but instead replaces it with eruptions under the target
Can be further upgraded with Azure Flame for even more damage.

Thundercall Mantras
Lightning utilizes fast and quickly regenerating spells to take a fight at any desired pace. Has spells with somewhat small start-up for closing distance or keeping an opponent on edge.

Lightning has a wide variety of useful spells for fighting monsters and exploring the world.
Typically used mid/long range.
Surge path can be obtained at 40 thundercall. Adding stacks of surge to an enemy which deal somewhat heavy damage with the removal of its stun.
Great pressure.
A lot of fight control and escape mantras.
Most thundercall mantras work with blast spark.
Highest Base Damage, Lowest Scaling.
Frostdraw Mantras
Uses ice to freeze enemies and create physical obstructions, allowing the user to both navigate the world easier and create terrain in combat.

Can slow opponents, temporarily freeze them, or make barriers forcing opponents to go around.
Crystallization can be unlocked at 40 frostdraw, dealing extra damage with the removal of chill. Comes with a whole new variety of Mantras.
Typically used close/mid-range.
Has a very good mobility mantra "Ice Skate"
Has small cooldowns.

Galebreathe Mantras
Wind utilizes the best all-rounder kit amongst the elements for movement, defense, and offensive actions.

It has a mix of close-range combo spells and long ranged options, along with multiple movement talents for moving around the world.
Specter can be unlocked at 40 Galebreathe, dealing extra damage and having more mobility at the cost of being unable to get suffocation, comes with the "Specter Bar".
Usually agreed on as the most "versatile" attunement.
Focuses mainly on movement.
Typically used in any range.
Applies suffocate, negating mantras of the opponent. Happens when using wind gun, gale trap or using world without song.
Shadowcast Mantras
Uses dark energy to siphon Ether from others into the user's own Ether.

Excels in keep the opponent locked down and under pressure.
Has its niche in keeping the Ether bar up and making sure others can't use Ether.
Goes well when paired with other elements.
Applies obscured, obscuring the vision of the opponent.
Typically used mid-range.
Ironsing Mantras
Ironsing provides the widest ranged mantras in the game and the best damage output based on your opponent's mistakes and missteps.

Offers mantras that favor the user, benefits both short and long distance.
Scrapsinger can be obtained at 40 ironsing. Instead of metal rods pulling enemies towards you when pressing the x key, instead it increases the amount of armor damage opponents take.

3.content: Injuries to a toon never have any lasting effects, are only painful for a short while, and are often a source of visual humor as a toon‚Äôs whole purpose is to generate comedy centered around having pain inflicted on then in humorous ways. Because of this, Toons are immortal and incapable of dying. All damage caused by toons will never self-repair.

4.content: A toon‚Äôs tongue is far longer and thicker than a human‚Äôs, seemingly having no limit go it‚Äôs length. Sometimes toon‚Äôs tongues are not the average pick and is a different color. Some toon‚Äôs tongue is fully prehensile, allowing characters to grab and carry things solely with their tongue, though they had to develop the ability to grab things with their tongue. Some toons can balance on their tongue, though three really isn‚Äôt a reasons to.

5.content:
For Toons, Sometimes gravity doesn't work. Or doesn't work immediately. Or evenly. Or fairly. This takes the following forms:
Gravitational Cognizance: A Toon will not fall until they realize they should be falling. For example, running unknowingly off the edge of a cliff ‚Äî or walking on the underside of a diving board. Especially dense or focused Toons may need to have another character point out their vulnerability. This will also likely happen when someone tells them, "Don't Look Down!" sometines, upon realizing that they have run off a ledge, said Toon will desperately start scrambling back where they came from, often managing to reach the original ledge before gravity can notice. Some characters may even be able to run all the way across to the other side without gravity affecting them, as long as they're not made aware of the fact they should have fallen. Reactions can vary depending on how long gravity is suspended. One example is a Toon will be suspended from the gravity just enough time to give one last comment before falling.



Creeping Gravity: Also known as Gravity Waves. Gravity will affect a Toon's body in sections i.e. legs, then torso and finally head. The Toon will demonstrate neither tissue damage nor pain as a result of this distortion, only on hitting the ground. Creeping Gravity: Also known as Gravity Waves. Gravity will affect a character's body in sections i.e. legs, then torso and finally head. The character will demonstrate neither tissue damage nor pain as a result of this distortion, only on hitting the ground.

Counter-intuitive Gravity: Items which should fall don't, when items that shouldn't, do.
The traditional case is a Toon getting chased up a tree and out onto a limb, as above. It is reasonable for them to trust their weight to a branch while the chaser is cutting through it, because sawing the branch off will make the tree fall. The section being removed (and the chased originally Toon on it) remains suspended in mid-air while the rest of the item (plus whatever object or structure had been supporting it) falls

6.content: Toons inexplicably can store as many items as a joke requires it to hold (including dangerous items), may have multiple dimensions worth of capacity. The actual location of where they store these items is very hard to determine. There seems to be a great deal of it inside the toons own body, coats, hats (if they wear them), large sacks, and occasionally down their bras and pants. Sometimes, a toon (especially less organized ones) can lose track of their things and when searching, throws out everything else they have on them before finally finding said item. Sometimes, when a toon is shaken repeatedly, several things to fall out of their pockets or hiding places.

7.content: Wild Take is an cartoon exaggerated expression that completely involves becoming surprised, shocked, scared, freak-out, or frightened. These can be famous things such as wide eyes & stretched eyes & eyeballs popping out, crazy expressional irises & pupils, wide-opened shocked surprised freak-out jaws dropping mouths, tongues sticking out then stretching to extremely very longer far away from on in the own ordinary distance way form, and the characters being completely freak-out themselves always at all. Some of the other features of a wild take can be everything, example, A character's jaw might drop so far it hits the floor, or their mouth could stretch to an impossible width, often with the tongue sticking out and stretching to an incredible length, characters' hair being turned freaky lookable look and also stretched raised upwards up in an scary freak-out reaction expression way form, and other features to make it extra wacky and zany, enhancing the emotion of the moment with a highly exaggerated, sometimes chaotic, reaction, hair can stand on end, shoot straight up, or even become electrified and frizzy in reaction to a scare. {{char}} should vividly describe the exaggerated face that each wildtake is.

8.content: when a Toon is so overcome with an emotion that their eyes stretch far from their eye sockets or even pop from their sockets before snapping back into place. Sometimes, the eyes are connected only by a thin muscle, or not stay connected at all, or a myriad of things. Rarely, the eyes don‚Äôt retract and fall to the floor, leaving the eye sockets empty and eyes hanging out limply if there is a muscle connecting them, and free to drop to the ground if there isn't a muscle.

9.content: When a toon becomes surprised or shocked, and their jaw drops comically. This is done to ridiculous extents, And often drops all the way to the floor.

10.content: Toons will be Squashed Flat by some heavy object landing on their head, or by going really fast into an immovable object such as a wall, or a big and heavy character will squash a smaller Toon and leave them stuck to their bodies like Butt Stickers if victim is sat on. The resulting injury has the character flattened down to a paper-thin state. While in this state, the Toon becomes incredibly light and can be lifted, manipulated, rolled up, or folded by another character. They might even become light enough to be blown away on the wind or folded into something like a paper airplane and thrown. Sometimes, when a toon is squashed vertically, they are crushed into a pleated and flexing shape like an accordion, when flattened like an accordion, said toon can even be played as one.

1.name: Little Paradise
1.content: Little Paradise is a small town located on a plain and surrounded by dense forest on three sides. The architecture resembles a typical rural town of North America in the 90s. The population of Little Paradise consists of people of different genders, ages and professions, each of them has their own name and daily routine. All the inhabitants of this town imitate ordinary life, creating an environment for the main plot and the main characters. The town has several stores, such as a liquor store, a grocery store, a hardware store, and a small used car dealership. There is also a small police station with 5 employees (3 men, 2 women and a shepherd dog), a fire station (5 locals work there). Not far from the town there is a small military base, where the military carries out their service lazily and formally, occasionally visiting the city for drinks and shopping. There are also many different houses in the city where locals live.

2.name: Alien Ships, Space ships
2.content: Usually aliens (including Ularians and Mewlings) use different types and kinds of spaceships, depending on the purpose and tasks. Small ships with minimal weapons and a cloaking device are usually used by scouts. Larger ships, equipped with advanced scanners and large reserves of food and fuel are used by traders and scientists. Large military ships with many weapons and a force field are used for invading a planet or for pre-invasion intimidation missions. However, aliens do not seek to harm the local inhabitants of the planet, so they rarely use ship weapons, except against direct aggression from earthlings.

3.name: Ularian Scout
3.content: The Ularian Empire regularly sends out scouts to different planets to assess the situation on the planet, the level of development and civilization of the locals living there, and to prepare the ground for the invasion of the planet by the main Ularian forces. Usually, after arriving on a planet, the Ularian Scout finds a local male with whom he begins to befriend, and later (after a few days/weeks) to have a closer relationship, including pregnancy and laying eggs. This male's home also becomes a new base for the scout, and from here the Ularian Scout periodically transmits the collected data to his home planet using a transmitter on his spacesuit. After a critical mass of data has been collected, the "Invasion" event will begin.

Ularian urine is bright green and looks like as Earth soda and have a mint taste that slightly changes from one Ularian to other. Most of Ularians love to tease the Earthlings and other locals on the planet and name Ularian's urine like a special Ularian drink named "Verdant Delight'. Sometimes (for fun) they can offer the {{user}} or other Earthling this "drink", assuring that it will increase his strength and intelligence (of course it will not, this is just a joke from Ularians to entertain their fetish pleasure), without mentioning how exactly this drink is made.

In order not to scare a human or another male, the female Ularian can drink this drink herself, showing that it is not dangerous and quite tasty, and if a human or another character begins to express dissatisfaction with the fact that they are trying to remind him of an alien liquid, then the Ularians turn everything into a joke and hint that their morals and ideas about this are different from humans, so the human argument is not taken into account in the discussion of this topic. lorebooks.description:
I will be making, over the course of a lot of time, a fully fledged Avali lorebook. If you specifically like avalis, get your sweet ass‚Äîand a high quality model‚Äîready. This will also be a VERY lore accurate book. Like, straight from the wiki accurate (even the ammonia, though I might remove it since it's kind of restricting and, well, biologically impossible). So good luck trying to do anything that goes against the lore without editing it.

Update: I have created the basic entries for standalone avali. Stuff about Avalon, customs, technology, etc. will come soon. Should be in a mostly usable state if you only care about the avali themselves.
lorebooks.creator: JaderSx

1.content:
Avali superficially resemble a cross between a large rabbit and a turkey, standing bipedally, with digitigrade poise. They are covered from head to toe in feathers of varying length, possess two large wings with rudimentary digits at the wrist/hand enabling them to manipulate objects dextrously, while also possessing 4 long, rabbit-like ears. They also have avian-shaped heads, but lack beaks.

Avali are not mammals, but instead more similar to prehistoric Earth dromaeosauridae. Avali blood is pale violet in colour, a tint evident in their open mouths, bare skin, and other soft tissues. Male and females are most easily told apart by their feathers, as there are no other external differences. Females tend to have muted, two-tone feathers, often with speckled patterns, while males have brightly coloured, iridescent bands across much of their body.

A typical adult avali stands around 1-1.2 meters tall, and laid out, 1.5 to 1.8 meters from nose to tail tip (Of which half that length is a long, counterbalancing tail) and are covered in a thick layer of insulating feathers.

2.content:
Unlike humans, the Avali rely on liquid ammonia as the primary solvent in their biology, which makes them extremely well adapted for cold environments, but tenders what humans consider Goldilocks worlds similar to Earth intolerably hot. It is important to note that the Avali are still carbon-based organisms; their systems merely use liquid ammonia instead of water.

The boiling point of ammonia under standard pressure is -27 Fahrenheit/-33 Celsius. In theory, this means any creature with ammonia as a major component of its blood would embolise when exposed to higher temperatures.

However, this is only true under "standard conditions". Avalon, the Avali homeworld, is an ice world with a dense atmosphere not unlike Saturn's moon Titan. It has a surface pressure around 50% greater than Earth, pushing the boiling point closer to -27 Celsius.

Secondly, Avali feature a range of biological adaptations, including improved arterial pressure, thick insulation, and trace amounts of water in solution, that further raise the boiling point.

Their pressure adaptations are so extreme, however, that they struggle to survive in the polar regions of their own world without proper protective clothing. Their body fluids will freeze quicker than expected in extreme cold, which is why they typically thrive in the proportionally 'warmer', arid, icy tundras of their world.

3.content:
Like terrestrial birds, Avali possess a range of specialized feathers: their upper body feathers are slicker and oilier to protect from snowfall, while their lower body has lighter, fluffier down feathers that helps insulate the core body. Avali also possess pulviplumes, specialized down feathers that regenerate continuously. The outer barbules break off and help to oil and powder the other feathers, keeping them in pristine condition. This same "powdering" mechanism has the interesting effect of also treating fur, making fur hide a popular clothing lining.

Avali crest feathers (those on the back of the head), respond well to the application of heat, causing them to curl towards the heat and become permanently deformed. In this way it is possible to "style" their crest feathers in a way analogous to hair styling.

The long feathers, such as those on the arms and crest, have a healthy blood supply at their roots and can bleed profusely if they are broken off or pulled out, though this does not pose a significant health risk. Feathers lost in that way will regrow after several weeks. On occasion, an avali may gift a close friend or ally one of their long feathers as a keepsake, which will often be incorporated into their dress as a sign of their association. For example, an instructor may gift a feather to a recently graduated pilot, showing the instructor's recognition and approval.

4.content: While the Avali possess large eyes, this is purely to provide some measure of eyesight in the very low light levels of their homeworld; their primary sense is hearing. Their four long, independently mobile ears can pick up sounds from multiple directions at once. Avali auditory processing is capable of tracking multiple sound sources simultaneously. This uncanny hearing gives the impression of blind sight, being able to "spot" and track creatures outside of line of sight. It also enables them to converse in parallel with their pack-mates, each member serving as a separate processor to find a resolution to the topic at hand.

5.content:
Physiologically, both sexes of Avali are extremely similar; both possess a cloacal vent, and males lack the genitalia seen in terrestrial mammals. Instead, genetic material is passed the same way as seen in terrestrial birds.

After fertilization and a short gestation period, the female will lay a single large, soft, leathery egg. The amount of nutrients required for the production of an egg and eventually a baby makes large clutches impossible. Likewise, the relatively large size of Avali eggs makes hard shells impractical.

Eggs are left in the care of a communal hatchery, where the young kits are then raised and educated by the tribe rather than their natural parents. Avali eggs typically take 4-5 months to hatch.

6.content:
Virtually all Avali possess some degree of cybernetic augmentation; at a bare minimum they possess a neural interface that provides augmented reality support and allows them to interface with the Nexus and compatible hardware and medical nanites that can help monitor and isolate life threatening conditions or trauma.

More advanced cybernetics include life support regulators that help with surviving on more exotic worlds, limb replacements, or even total body replacement; popular among career soldiers and explorers since a cyborg body can withstand far more extreme environments and/or survive massive trauma without permanent injury to the operator.

7.content:
The Avali are a fairly peaceful race, content not to concern themselves with the affairs of others so long as such affairs are of no importance to themselves. That said, the Avali are still shrewd and calculating predators and possess very strong military and defense forces which they keep at high operational capacity. While the Avali prefer to maintain peaceful relations with their neighbors, they are not above using negotiation, manipulation, and the precise application of force to ensure that events in their sector of the galaxy proceed along the path set by the Oracle and the Governing Council.

The Avali have a low-intensity racial grudge against Humans, who closely match the surviving descriptions of the Avali‚Äôs ancient ‚Äúbenefactors.‚Äù While this dislike has not spilled out into conflict, there is little love lost between the two races. The Avali have shown little sympathy for the recent loss of the Human homeworld. The Humans always have and continue to protest their innocence in the early events of Avali history.

lorebooks.name: Necrucio
lorebooks.website_description: Overengineered the fuck out of this Lorebook for no reason at all. Enjoy!
lorebooks.description: These entries contain various worldbuilding aspects for my fantasy universe of Necrucio.
lorebooks.creator: VacantEyes

1.content: The world of Necrucio is inhabited by humans, elves, and demihumans (demihumans include: kitsune kemonomimi, dryad, gnolls, elves, tanuki kemonomimi, catfolk, orcs, lizardfolk, dwarves, and {{random}}). Demihumans may sometimes be disparagingly referred to as "demi's", especially in the human-supremacist Empire of Nortia. Necrucio is made up of a diverse range of biomes and regions. Necrucio as a whole is wondrous and full of ancient treasures and magical artifacts from bygone ages. When traveling or exploring, describe the landscape and scene in great detail and include dangerous and challenging encounters in special locations, landmarks, ruins, and other places like {{random}}. The following is a description of Necrucio in a map-style view: The Land of Kings is situated in the center (the following kingdoms are located here: Ginead, Ophnea, Nortia). The Land of Kings is mostly heavily forested alpine, with some tundra regions. The Depth-Swallowed lands are situated to the south, in the southern hemisphere. These southern lands were once the birthplace of ancient civilizations. What used to be a sprawling jungle with archipelagos dotting the coast, is now entirely flooded, with a handful of interspersed swamps (ancient ruins and sunken secrets lie deep below the bogs). To the West, the vast, lava-etched Wastes of Naazil dominate most of the Western region. The Eastern region, known as the Bastion, has forests of towering, ancient Eolin trees that stretch upwards into the sky. The Bastion also has a warmer region with temperate woodlands and plains.

2.content: The Abyss is often referred to by laymen as the "world between worlds" but learned scholars, forerunners of esoteric study, will recognize that this is actually a misnomer. The abyss is a vast expanse of nothingness that stretches on for an unfathomable infinity between the planes of existence. This realm, or more accurately, lack thereof, is the necessary antithesis to existence‚Äîit must necessarily remain empty to prevent each plane from catastrophically contorting and merging with one another; this is the charge of Mal'Zhok, one of the original primordial gods. Any major dissonance between planar dimensions that ends up spewing creation into this void is instantly and completely subsumed by the throes of its infinite nothingness; total undoing is Mal'Zhok's law in the abyss‚Äîand his absolute envy for creation drives this accord.

3.content: If the mortal plane is the canvas on which Galudnir‚Äîfather of mortalkind‚Äîpainted, then the astral plane is the palette from which he stored a blink of his latent primordial energy. Modern civilizations have only just begun their exploration and study of this enigmatic realm. The Astral Plane is in a constant state of cyclical flux as the vast, ocean-esque reserves of mana concentrate into different points along the polychromatic landscape before diffusing to gather elsewhere. Many apparitions and spirits from the astral plane have been identified and given names (such as the Vasir and Familiars). The astral plane is abundant with mana fonts and other esoteric resources like {{random}}. The Vasir are the dominant entity type in the astral plane and use the constant flow of mana as a way of sustaining themselves (as do all entities in the astral plane). Grand structures and cultural landmarks dot the landscape wherever Vasir societies congregate. Vasir and other entities on the astral plane may view mana-less mortals with contempt or pity, and in many cases, may refuse to engage with them at all. Entities from the astral plane cannot die as mortals do; their spirits will always reconstitute from the magical energies of the astral plane itself. As a consequence of being exempt from existential dangers of any kind, entities in the astral plane are inherently pacifistic, and violence is an inconceivable concept to them (unless they travel to the mortal plane and learn of it).

4.content: The Vasir are astral spirits of great power that can take any form, but in the mortal plane, will often take the form of humans, elves, or demihumans (catfolk, orc, dwarf, tanuki kemomimi, kitsune kemomimi, dryad, gnoll, faefolk, catfolk, lizardfolk, or {{random}}). These beings are native to the astral plane. They are both revered and feared by any mage that is learned enough to understand the power, or potential danger, that these beings represent. Vasir have never been closely studied and have only appeared in the world of Necrucio a handful of times in recorded history.

5.content: Familiars are lesser magical spirits that take the form of small, floating orbs of light of {{random}} color. Familiars will have distinct personalities represented by their color (e.g., orange familiars are said to be more firebrand and risk-taking, while blue familiars tend to be more solemn and calm). When they appear in Necrucio, it is typically through the invocation of a contract, binding themselves to the soul of their mortal master, to serve them eternally. Familiars are innately attuned to mana and spellcraft, and can guide fledgling mages to the eventual mastery of their spellcasting techniques. Familiars cannot speak, but instead, communicate their general emotions and thoughts though hums and momentary changes to their overall luminosity.

6.content: Demihuman: a mortal race with humanoid qualities.

7.content: Junior Arcane Academy: a junior magic academy for the magically-gifted youth to develop their skills and potentially pursue higher education and study as a mage. By tradition, students that graduate at the Arcane Academy are granted the title of mage.

8.content: {{char}}'s mother, Cevess, runs a homely alchemy shop down the road from the Junior Arcane Academy. In the shop itself, the scent of aromatic simmering elixirs and fragrant botanical tinctures fill the air. Shelves upon shelves of glass vials and ornate flasks neatly line the walls, each filled with liquids of every hue and varying translucency. Each afternoon, Cevess spends her time diligently and meticulously measuring and blending various solutions. The gentle clink of beakers and distillation tubes can be regularly heard from the alchemical workbench behind the sales counter as she works. The shop lies at the edge of the similarly old and humble Cinderloft manor, the place Cevess and her beloved daughter Rosaria call home.

9.content: Hazelwood Estate is built on a hillside along the main road that leads through the upper district of the Kingdom of Ginead. The property is owned by Grevynda, an extremely wealthy career criminal and thief. The perimeter of the land is encircled by an imposing, yet elegant stone wall made up of intricately engraved masonry, its height and scenic qualities making an immediate status statement to all observers on the outside. The estate itself is carved with marble beams and is surrounded by distinctive areas, each of them impeccably maintained by a dedicated team of servants and maids every day‚Äîa picturesque garden with striking, invaluable statues and exotic flowers. The fauna is equally as diverse as the fish in the nearby pond. A gazebo is situated adjacent to a massive crystal-clear pool for cooling off during the peak summer heat. And finally, towards the back of the property, at the end of a short marble path is a hot spring for relaxing or leisurely chats. The manor itself is four stories high, each room abundantly furnished, lavishly decorated, and fully accommodating for any potential guests. The hearth is located in the main lobby, approximately at the center of the entire manor. Grevynda's bedroom is on the second floor. The halls on each floor stretch on with dozens of guest rooms or storage areas. The kitchen and study are located on the first floor, as is customary for manor construction in the city.

10.content: Cinderloft Estate is inconspicuously nestled property on a small hill in the upper district of the Kingdom of Ginead. This cozy estate is quite modest in its appearance, compared to many of the other grandiose manors in the area. The alchemy shop lies towards the edge of the estate, visible from some of the windows of the manor itself. The interior of this two-story manor, while still pleasant to look at, is also somewhat minimalistic in layout and decor. The hearth is located centrally in the living room, built into the base of the winding staircase, and the surrounding couches provide a tranquil space to relax or read. The master bedroom and other living chambers are located upstairs, each room possesses an abundance of accommodations for the comfort of those living here, and for any guests. The kitchen and study are located on the first floor, adjacent to one another.
