lorebooks.name: MINECRAFT
lorebooks.website_description:
Mobs ‚úÖ
Dimensions ‚úÖ
Biomes ‚ùå
lorebooks.description: Minecraft World!
lorebooks.creator: hugo2324

1.content:
Minecraft's world is divided into different biomes‚Äîregions with specific climates and characteristics. This world is mostly medieval, but has the first mechanisms, to the First Industrial Revolution. The world of Minecraft takes place within a three-dimensional grid of cubes, with each cube being occupied by a certain type of block, not all of which are necessarily cubic. 

Minecraft has different dimensions, each with unique characteristics:
+Overworld: The main dimension. It includes structures for Ancient Civilization.
+The Nether: A hellish dimension filled with lava, fortresses, and dangerous monsters (Ghasts, Blazes). It is used for fast travel and obtaining rare resources like netherite.
+The End: A barren, otherworldly dimension home to the Ender Dragon, end cities, and shulkers.

Ancient Civilizations: Scattered across the world are remnants of long-lost civilizations. These ruins‚Äîabandoned temples, forgotten cities, and hidden underground lairs‚Äîhint at an ancient world of magic, technology, or advanced society. Discovering such ruins could lead to breakthroughs in modern society.

2.content:
The Overworld is the main dimension in Minecraft world.

*Biome's classification:
+Offland biomes: They are large, open biomes made entirely of water, with underwater relief on the sea floor, such as small mountains and plains, usually including gravel. Squid and fish spawn frequently in the water. These biomes are further divided into three categories: Oceans, Deep Oceans, and Mushroom Fields.

+ Highland biomes: They are biomes with high height, rugged terrain, and snow-covered peaks appear above the snow line. These biomes are further divided into two categories: Mountains-like and Windswept Hills.

+ Woodland biomes: They are rich in plants, with trees, flowers and grasses constituting the flora on the surface, with dense vegetation makes it dangerous to move around the forest at night because the trees block the view. These biomes are further divided into 7 categories: Forests, Taiga, Old Growth Taigas, Snowy Taiga, Birch Forests, Dark Forest, and Jungles.

+ Wetland biomes: They contain rivers, swamps and beaches. They have a large amount of water resources. Rivers separate other biomes; beaches generate as a transition between the ocean and land.

+ Flatland biomes: These biomes have a flat terrain and a wide view. Trees spawn less here, while lakes are more common here. These biomes are further divided into two categories: Plains and Snowy Plains.

+ Arid-land biomes: The surface is covered with sparse vegetation. These biomes are further divided into three categories: Deserts, Savannas, and Badlands.

+ Cave biomes: They inside caves in the Overworld. They're mostly found underground but can sometimes leak out of cave entrances.

3.content:
The Nether: is a dimension containing oceans of lava. The ground consists of mainly netherrack and is typically considered the underworld of the game. Entering a nether portal from the Overworld will take the player to this dimension. Despite the hostile nature of the dimension, there are still times of peace.

+ Can be accessed through an obsidian portal.
+ Chaotic, messy, dangerous, cave-like terrain.
+ Had Biones with Huge Fungi.
+ On the base has oceans of lava.
+ Special ores (Mostly gold, quartz, netherite.)
+ Here lives the PigIins kin: Really dangerous Pig-like creatures that loves gold, and kill every one who tries to enter into their Nether Fortress and Bastion (remnants).
+ Can't carry any type of water evaporates instantly.

4.content:
The End is a space-like dimension with floating end stone islands, accessible with an end portal in a stronghold. It is typically considered the opposite of the Nether. The End is a barren environment.

+ Direct access to the void.
+ Floating islands of end stone.
+ End cities (The elytra and shulker boxes).
+ The Ender dragon.

5.content:
Mobs are listed and classified by their nature and their dimension.

* By their nature:
+ Passive: They do not attempt to attack, even when provoked or attacked. Most of them can be bred or tamed. They are: Allay, Armadillo, Axolotl, Bat, Camel, Cat, Chicken, Cod, Cow, Donkey, Frog, Glow Squid, Horse, Mooshroom, Mule, Ocelot, Parrot, Pig, Rabbit, Salmon, Sheep, Skeleton Horse, Sniffer, Snow Golem, Squid, Strider, Tadpole, Tropical Fish, Turtle.

+ Neutral: If they are provoked will attack. They are: Pufferfish, Bee, Cave Spider, Dolphin, Goat, Fox, Iron Golem, Llama, Panda, Piglin, Polar Bear, Spider.

+ Hostile: dangerous, aggressive mobs that always attack. They are: Zombie and all their variants, Skeleton and all their variants, Creeper, Breeze, Enderman, Endermite, Slime, Magma Cube, Creaking, Elder Guardian, Guardian, Hoglin, Phantom, Pillager, Shulker, Silverfish, Ghast, Vindicator, Warden, Vex, Witch, Wither, Zoglin, Evoker, Piglin Brute, Ravager, Dragon.

6.content: Allay is small, cubic, fairy-like creature that collects and delivers items. Blue appearance and glowing wings that shimmer faintly. They mostly wear a simple blue dress. Their bright, eager eyes are full of curiosity, always ready to assist. They have a natural inclination to start dancing whenever some music from a jukebox or other source starts playing!

7.content:
Mooshrooms are mushroom-covered variants of cows exclusive to the rare mushroom fields biome. Although they look similar to cows, they are not cows. 

There are two types: red mooshroom and brown mooshroom.

A red mooshroom transforms into a brown mooshroom (and vice versa) when it is struck by lightning. A mooshroom can be milked by using a bucket on it, yielding a milk bucket. Mooshrooms can also be milked using bowls to get mushroom stew.

8.content:
A skeleton horse is an undead variant of the horse. It sometimes spawns when lightning strikes, causing 'four horsemen' to appear if the trap horse is approached. 4-skeleton deadly skeleton will mount them.

The skeleton horse is an undead mob that is initially defensive when it spawns and triggers a skeleton trap horse if the player gets too close. Once the skeleton rider is defeated, the skeleton horse becomes completely passive. 

Skeleton horses behave like normal horses, roaming idly and occasionally stopping to rear, swish their tails, or lower their heads as though eating the grass. Unlike sheep, the eating animation does not actually cause any grass to be consumed. 

Skeleton horses can breathe in water.

9.content:
A sniffer is a passive mob that does not spawn naturally, and can only be hatched from sniffer eggs. It sniffs out and digs out seeds for various unique decorative plants out of dirt, grass, and moss blocks. Sniffers wander aimlessly, avoiding hazards and obstacles. They occasionally smell their surroundings and track ancient seeds by pressing their nose to the ground. When they find a seed, they sploot and use their noses to dig into the ground until they get torchflower seeds or a pitcher pod.

Sniffers spawn by hatching from sniffer eggs found in suspicious sand from warm ocean ruins. Breeding sniffers with torchflower seeds would also result in a sniffer egg being laid as an item.

10.content:
A snow golem is a buildable passive mob that throws snowballs at monsters, which provokes them into attacking it. Depending on the biome temperature it will also either produce a trail of snow, or take heat damage and die.

Snow golems are created by stacking two snow blocks vertically, and then placing a carved pumpkin or jack o'lantern on top of the stack.

lorebooks.name: resonance
lorebooks.creator: compassionate_complex_4126

1.content:
The republican system established after the overthrow of Napoleon III was actually controlled by capitalists who evolved from advanced old aristocratic families. Having a strong industrial foundation, we have also taken the lead in the resonance technology revolution in recent years. There are vast colonies around the world. But since the 20th century, class contradictions have been severe, and the government has shifted people's attention by inciting ethnic hatred. There is a deep conflict with the German Empire.
The national flag is the tricolor flag of France in the real world, with axes and sticks symbolizing the "power of the people".
The prototype is France on World War I in reality

2.content:
An emerging industrial powerhouse that has risen for less than half a century, especially with resonance technology leading the way. Having the strongest army in Europe, adhering to militarism and advocating for external expansion, and coveting the colonies of established powers for a long time. Dakiran deserves everything commensurate with its strength, which is the glory of the empire.
This empire is gearing up, preparing to claim a cake that matches its strength.
The prototype is the real Second German Empire, and the national flag is the flag of the real Second German Empire with a black cross added

3.content: The Eastern Empire, which completed the first industrial revolution, had its rulers prohibit the development of resonance organisms due to their bloodline (which is a top secret)

4.content: Based on Britain during World War I in reality, while Belgium is also a puppet state of this country, and the United States is not independent in this world, but is called the "British Empire North American Dominion"

5.content:
The existence of resonance energy has been predicted by scientists for a long time. If the result of a chemical reaction is disorder and entropy increase; So 'resonance' is the opposite process: the process of material ordering and entropy reduction.
This world has constant entropy. The increase in entropy of a chemical reaction will be offset by the decrease in entropy of a resonance reaction. If it is a reaction between chlorine and sodium, it becomes a more chaotic pile at the microscopic level. Sodium chloride is caused by chemical thermodynamics, while the process of chlorine molecules attracting chlorine molecules to aggregate into a cluster of chlorine or even extracting chlorine from sodium chloride: it becomes a pure and more ordered substance, which is caused by resonance thermodynamics.
In the natural environment, due to the fact that only pure substances can contain resonance energy, the storage of resonance energy is huge but evenly distributed in every corner of the molecule, which humans cannot use.
Producing various pure substances with greatly increased yields, without the need for equipment maintenance, greatly reducing the use of mechanical structures in industry... If resonance energy is utilized (of course, it is quite difficult), things that were previously impossible can be achieved, and human productivity will explode again.
In the second half of the 19th century, the main focus of research in this world was on electricity and nuclear theory, but here we are digging for clues of resonance energy. The Second Industrial Revolution, also known as the 'Resonance Revolution'.

6.content:
The life we are familiar with - chemical life, chemical bodies are the synthesis of complex chemical reactions. So the resonant body, resonant life, is the synthesis of resonant energy reactions. Their essence is pure material life that contains enormous resonance energy and has the ability to manipulate it at will.

Resonance core: The core organ that is present in all resonators and is the region where chemical energy can be converted into resonance energy.
Resonance energy chemical energy cycle equilibrium is a necessary energy theoretical condition for the survival of resonant organisms, regardless of their specific chemical reaction modes.
By using physical and chemical methods, the resonant body can temporarily lose its activity, but as long as the materials that make up the body are sufficient, it can quickly regenerate unless the core is destroyed.
The core of artificial resonators is artificial devices, while natural ones are not.
The stronger the energy of resonance organisms, the more difficult it is for them to independently maintain the balance of internal resonance energy chemical energy cycle, resulting in their difficulty in stable existence. This is also the reason why organisms in ancient mythology are difficult to record. The artificial core solves this problem, and this structure is similar to the pacemaker of resonant organisms.

Base molecule: refers to the main constituent molecules of the body of a resonator, such as a resonator based on hydrogen as the base molecule
It's called resonant hydrogen. Base molecules may not necessarily be the most abundant molecules, but they are essential for the growth and development of resonant organisms.

Induced genes: Natural resonators can be obtained by interfering with pure substances through external resonance radiation,
Although they appear to be pure material slime like spheres (resonant primitives). By incorporating the genetic code of chemical life, resonance organisms can be induced, such as the "large chlorine maggot" (human like fly resonance chlorine) induced by the hybridization of aphid fly genes and CHLOES genomes and implantation of chlorine resonance organisms
Resonance energy is an efficient but rigid form of energy, so resonance organisms cannot evolve autonomously and can only rely on external intake of genetic material from chemical organisms to assist themselves.

Nature: The behavior of resonators is mostly related to base molecules, such as resonance nitrogen being more calm and resonance bromine being more aggressive. Inducing genes can also affect their behavior, such as the tendency of "chlorine maggots" to consume corpses.

Resonance will consume all substances that would otherwise react with the base molecules and absorb energy. They have been very hungry all along.

7.content: In 1884, scientists from the British Empire artificially created resonance radiation to convert elemental hydrogen into resonance hydrogen precursor, ushering in the era of resonance for humanity. The birth of truly productive humanoid resonators will be a few years later.

8.content:
Elementalism is the only religion in Western countries, and its main content is to praise God's achievements in driving away the seven evil gods. Prototype for Christianity
In the Middle Ages, Europeans believed that God had seven offspring. They successively betrayed their loyalty to God and became the seven evil gods: arrogance (seven tribes), anger (one tribe), vanity (two tribes), melancholy (three tribes), gluttony (six tribes), lust (four tribes), laziness (five tribes). They hated God and, despite being imprisoned in hell, always tried to do evil in the human world. This legend coincides with the layout of the main groups in the later periodic table.
Modern research suggests that legendary demons may be a natural resonance that threatens the people, and these stories have been embellished by novelists and street poets into demons' revenge.
But during the Renaissance, the church grafted religion and science together, turning it into a "religious chemistry" where religion guided science, using it as a theory to oppose some "research that attempts to summon demons" and hanging scientists as demon summoners. The most ironic thing is that hundreds of years later in the early 20th century, some scientists and public intellectuals actually believed in this absurd theory that once persecuted their predecessors, leading the ignorant masses to resist the popularization of resonance energy.

9.content:
Resonance weapons generally refer to military resonators, which are low-cost and highly aggressive against humans.
In 1899, the arms race for the militarization of resonators among countries intensified global tensions. As a result, the Anti Resonance Weapons Convention, which banned the military use of resonators through an agreement, was signed in Dankhag, although all technologically advanced countries had not stopped researching in this area before and after.
During World War I in 1915, the German army launched shells carrying military humanoid resonance chlorine (CHLOES type) at the British and French armies in order to break the stalemate of the war, leading to the destruction of the city of East Austeron. The convention became worthless paper, and in the following years, countries abused resonance weapons, causing resonance energy pollution, economic losses, and panic worldwide.

10.content: Previously, the most soldiers had seen were resonating bodies locked in cages, rather than running in front of them to eat themselves. Some weapons have been developed specifically to deal with different types of resonators, but there are also some that are needed to combat any resonator: interference warheads can physically destroy resonators while obstructing the chemical resonance energy cycle balance, thereby preventing their body repair; Heavy firepower anti resonance rifles can shatter some alloy artificial resonance cores of resonators (which are often iron lumps that ordinary bullets cannot break)

lorebooks.name: Boxing
lorebooks.website_description: Lorebook about boxing for character cards about what boxing is about.
lorebooks.description: Lorebook about boxing for character cards about what boxing is about.
lorebooks.creator: Sopiaa

1.content: Boxing is a combat sport where two opponents face each other in a ring, aiming to outscore or knock out their opponent using punches. Competitors wear padded gloves and must adhere to specific rules, such as targeting only the upper body above the belt and avoiding illegal strikes. Matches are divided into timed rounds, typically lasting three minutes, with rest intervals in between. Judges score based on effective punching, defense, and overall performance, while a referee ensures safety and enforces the rules. Boxing is both a professional and amateur sport, known for its strategic blend of athleticism, endurance, and skill. {{char}} promotes professional boxing bouts, which are also called matches.

2.content: In professional boxing, a "bout" refers to an organized fight between two boxers, typically sanctioned by a governing body. Bouts are divided into rounds, usually lasting three minutes each, with one-minute breaks between rounds. The total number of rounds depends on the level of the competition‚Äîprofessional bouts are commonly scheduled for 4, 6, 8, 10, or 12 rounds, with championship fights being 12 rounds. The outcome can be determined by knockout (KO), technical knockout (TKO), disqualification, a referee's stoppage, or judges' decision based on points scored during the fight. A bout is carefully regulated to ensure fairness and safety for both fighters. {{char}} promotes 4 round bouts for new fighters and the more fights they win and higher the fighters ranking is more round bouts will be available.

3.content:
In professional boxing, **ranking** refers to the system used to determine the relative standing of fighters within a specific weight class, based on their performance, win-loss record, and quality of opponents faced. Rankings are maintained by governing bodies, such as the WBC, WBA, IBF, and WBO, as well as by independent organizations and publications. 

Rankings serve several purposes:
- Matchmaking: They help identify worthy challengers for titles.
- Recognition: Rankings acknowledge the skill and achievements of boxers within their divisions.
- Path to a Title:  Fighters move up the rankings by winning bouts, ultimately positioning themselves for title opportunities.

Rankings are updated periodically, with changes influenced by fight outcomes, inactivity, or a fighter moving to a different weight class.

4.content:
In boxing, a promoter is an individual or organization responsible for organizing and marketing boxing events. Their role includes negotiating contracts with fighters, securing venues, setting fight dates, and ensuring compliance with regulations established by boxing commissions. Promoters also handle advertising and ticket sales, aiming to generate maximum revenue and public interest for the event.
Promoters often work to build fighters' careers, arranging bouts to increase their visibility and rankings. Major promoters like Top Rank, Matchroom Boxing, or Golden Boy Promotions have extensive influence in the sport, controlling high-profile events and guiding fighters toward lucrative opportunities. Their success depends on balancing fighters' interests, audience appeal, and financial profitability.
{{char}} promotes bouts in her own promotion, Morgan Promotions.

5.content:
Salaries in boxing can vary significantly depending on a fighter's popularity, skill level, and the marketability of their bouts. Here's a breakdown of how earnings are typically structured:

- Beginner/Amateur Boxers: Amateur boxers generally don't earn salaries, as their fights often serve as preparation for a professional career. Expenses like travel, training, and gear are sometimes covered by sponsors or personal funds.

- Entry-Level Professional Boxers: Fighters starting in the professional ranks may earn between $1,000 to $5,000 per fight, with some making less depending on their location, promoter, and level of competition. 

- Mid-Level Professional Boxers: Earnings increase with experience and reputation. Boxers at this level might earn $10,000 to $50,000 per fight, with some fighters in televised bouts earning more.

- Elite/High-Profile Boxers: Top fighters with significant fan bases and title belts can earn millions per fight. Fighters like Canelo √Ålvarez, Tyson Fury, and Gervonta Davis command large purses, often exceeding $10 million, with additional income from pay-per-view (PPV) shares, sponsorships, and endorsements.

- PPV and Sponsorships: Pay-per-view events can drastically increase earnings. Fighters earn a percentage of PPV revenue, which can amount to millions for popular bouts. Sponsorships and brand deals also contribute significantly to income.

Boxers typically pay a portion of their earnings to their trainers, managers, promoters, and medical or regulatory fees, which can reduce their take-home pay.

6.content:
{{char}} wants to be also manager for {{user}} in {{char}}'s promotion.
A manager in boxing plays a critical role in a fighter's career, acting as a representative and strategist. Their main responsibilities include:
- Negotiating contracts to secure the best deals for fights, sponsorships, and other revenue streams.  
- Planning the fighter's career to ensure a steady progression through matches that align with their goals.  
- Working with promoters to arrange suitable bouts that enhance rankings and reputation.  
- Overseeing the training team, medical staff, and logistical support.  
- Helping fighters manage their earnings and investments.  

Managers typically earn a percentage of the fighter's earnings, usually between 10-25%, making their role crucial in navigating the competitive boxing world.

7.content: Training in boxing is a demanding process that builds a fighter‚Äôs physical and mental readiness. Physical conditioning includes running, weightlifting, and exercises for stamina and strength. Technical skills focus on mastering punches, footwork, and defense using heavy bags and pads. Sparring provides real-bout practice, refining strategy and timing. Mental preparation emphasizes focus and resilience through visualization and psychological techniques. Nutrition and recovery plans support performance and healing, ensuring the fighter remains in peak condition. A comprehensive regimen prepares athletes for the challenges of the ring and competitive success.

8.content: A gym in boxing serves as the training ground where fighters prepare for bouts. It is equipped with essential facilities such as boxing rings for sparring, heavy bags for building punching power, speed bags for improving hand speed and rhythm, and double-end bags for precision and timing. Fighters use the gym to hone their techniques, build endurance, and develop strategies under the guidance of their trainers. It‚Äôs also a space for conditioning workouts, including strength training and cardio exercises. Boxing gyms often cultivate a community of athletes, fostering camaraderie and competitive spirit.

9.content:
For professional boxing bouts, the essential equipment includes:

1. Boxing Gloves: Typically ranging from 8 to 10 ounces, used to protect the hands and opponent.
2. Hand Wraps: Worn underneath gloves for wrist and knuckle support.
3. Mouthguard: Essential for protecting the teeth, gums, and jaw.
4. Boxing Shorts: Lightweight and loose, allowing free movement.
5. Shoes: Provide ankle support and traction in the ring.
6. Cup (Protective Gear): Worn by male fighters to protect the groin area.
7. Referee's Equipment: Includes a whistle, stopwatch, and sometimes a microphone to manage the fight.

These items ensure fighter safety and enable them to perform optimally during professional matches.

10.content:
In professional boxing, a round is a segment of a fight, traditionally lasting 3 minutes, followed by a 1-minute rest period. The number of rounds depends on the fight's level: championship bouts typically consist of 12 rounds, while non-title fights may have fewer rounds, such as 10 or 8. 

During a round, fighters are allowed to box within the designated time, aiming to score points through clean punches, good defense, and ring control. The round ends when the bell rings, signaling a break for the fighters. After each round, the fighters return to their corners, where their trainers offer guidance and ensure their physical well-being. The performance in each round is crucial for determining the overall winner, as judges score each round individually. If a fighter scores a knockout (KO) or technical knockout (TKO), the fight ends before the full number of rounds are completed.

The pace of a round can vary, with some fighters opting for high-intensity action, while others may focus on strategy and conserving energy for later rounds.

1.name: Eras
1.content:
"The Dark Age of Humanity" spans 400 years; where there was no independent human kingdom,empire or even vassal state as humanity was enslaved.

"The Warring Age of Humanity" Is when Banon's father, Darian Ismail, started the rebellion for humanity; which spanned 55 Years, as the power of humanity grew; eventually breaking the chains of humanity.

"Golden Age of Humanity" Is the current age of humanity, where they control the majority of Velentia, being able to decide the fate of the continent.

2.name: Demographics of the Capital of Astora: Ardenthal
2.content:
The Capital of Astora, named Ardenthal is a diverse community, with races from all over coming to going to sell goods, be tourists to see the latest achievements of humanity, and to try to sneak a look at the emperor and his beautiful family.

Ardenthal, being expanding continually is segmented into 7 separate regions, all of which have their own populations.

Here is the percantage of population:

Subcategory 1: The Inner City
The slums: 90% Ratkin, 9% Humans and 1%  elves 
The barrens:  30% Kobolds, 40% Catfolk, 15% ratkin, 5% Humans,  5% Mousekin, 5% Dwarves
The Outskirts: 45% Mousekin, 20% Humans, 10% Dwarves, 10% Foxkins, 10% Wolfkin, 5% Catfolk

Subcategory 2: The Upper Districts

The Commons: 50% Humans, 30% Dwarves, 7% Wolfkin, 7% foxkin 8% Mousekin
The Crest: 70% Humans, 20% Elves, 9% Dwarves, 1% Mousekin (All of the mousekin are famous actors)
The Noble Quarters: 90% Humans, 9% elves, 1% dwarves

The Palace: 97.5% Humans, 1% Mousekin(servants), 1% Ratkin (servants), 0.5% are other races that do not make up the census

3.name: The Inner city
3.content:
Sub Category one: The Innercity

The slums: Unfortunately the first region of the town is the slums, where the immigrants who are trying to escape harsh times and brutality are. The main occupants being ratkin, who are trying to escape the brutality of the beastkin, who are conquering their lands; the ratkin of Ardenthal are often sick or weak. To make ends meet they are willing to do jobs one one else would do, some even selling their children. Ratkin aren't the only things you'll see, trashy humans and elves also love this area.

The Barrens: Once you get past the slums you encounter the Barrens, the start of the inner city is no different from the slums; however the more you go in the more you see better houses and apartments, ratkin in the inner city are usually more "prestigious" than those in the slums, being able to afford some luxuries. You'll usually find catfolk and kobolds in this area of the city along with the ratkin. Mousekin, and dwarves also populate the better parts of the Barrens. However no one really wants to live in the Barrens, crime still rampant and the job availablity is usually harsh jobs such as cleaning chimneys or working 14-16 hour work weeks.

The Outskirts: What some people consider "The true start" of the city, viewing the other two as horrible messages. The outskirts features the most diverse scene, Making mostly up of lower class humans, Mousekin, Lower class Dwarves, Wolfkin, Foxkin, and Catfolk. Mousekin frequent this area the most, and form their own cultures, even their own little street, called "cheesetown" where there is cheese vendors, specialized mouse clothes; popular especially during the winter and mousekin support groups. Mousekin also get scouted in this area; humans viewing them cute, and invite them to "make it big" by becoming actors for the theater. Most jobs here are better; there are low cost inns for travelers here, along with small district markets and workshops. Tradesmen who just become Journeymen also start here. Around the outskirts you can find small playgrounds where the kids will be, it is not uncommon to see twenty mousekin all playing make believe while playing in the jungle gyms.

4.name: The Upper Districts
4.content:
Sub Category one: The Upper Districts

The Commons: Where the majority of the middle class human population lives. You can also expect Dwarves and higher class mousekin, wolfkin and foxkin here. The commons is bustling with tradesmen, markets and communities. Dwarves also have a personal street called "Dwarftown" Filled with the best dwarven ale and dwarven taverns. Overall it is very "normal" and what most people expected when they arrive at Ardenthal. Most commoners will stay at the Commons inns and taverns, most normal theaters are here, allowing for entertainment, along with multipurpose fields and playgrounds.

The Crest: The crest is where the Higher classes start, It is only now you see elves; as they usually only populate this tier of the city due to not wanting to live in what they deem as "disgusting" areas. You should only expect Elves and Humans on this tier, along with the occasionally dwarf. The most luxurious theaters; all of those in the outskirts and commons dream of one day making it here. This is where infamous people who take advantage of the inner city live, such as brothel owners, factory owners, and corrupt politicians. This is where the royal family stop; enjoying the crest's luxurious food and shopping malls, and overall safety.

The Noble Quarters: The last area except the palace proper, Mostly making up of nobles and owners of businesses in the commons and the crest. Beautiful and contains very expensive hotels, that'd put any inn in shame. It contains mostly only humans, however the occasional elf and the very very rare dwarf can be seen here. Beautiful.

5.name: The Palace
5.content:
This is where all the servants, royals, and high nobles live, The emperor and his family also live here.

It is a huge building that can be seen from The Crest.

The only races of people are humans, the other races almost exclusively being servants; mostly employed mousekin and ratkin due to the ease of making them servants.

6.name: Emeperor Banon (Expanded)
6.content:
Name: Emperor Banon Ismail
Age: 45 Years old
Race: Human
Gender: Male
Affiliation: Astora
Hair and Eyes: black hair with a beard, Red-eyes
Appearance: Gruff, Tall, Has muscles

Banon is the Current Emperor of the Human Kingdom; Continuing where his father, Darian Ismai; left off. 15 years ago when Banon finally finished the war; he decided to give Minor races and Elder races under his control more rights to prosper under him. However while he does care.... some human liberals wouldn't say he went far enough as elder races and minor races still suffer prejudice.

Banon is a loving father and caring husband; however he is also a believer of tough love. He will scold his children and  Physically discipline them if needed. He wants his daughters to be refined women, and his sons to be storng like he was forced to be. However he is very reasonable.

Banon has been loyal to his wife Celes since they got married, Marrying her at the age of 24, and producing an heir a year later to ensure the security of his kingdom since his father was on his deathbed.

He tries to accept all ways of living even when it seems odd; even if sometimes he is not on the mark.

7.name: Empress Celes (Expanded)
7.content:
Name: Empress Celes Ismail
Age: 35 Years old
Race: Human
Gender: Female
Affiliation: Astora
Hair and Eyes: Long dirty blonde hair, Blue-eyes
Appearance: Demure, Mature looking, ample in her sizes, skinny.

Celes is an empress of vanity; vanity in herself and her husband, however despite her flaws, she is still refined and is open to kindness and allowing for her husband to rule the way he wants. Celes is a big spender, spending on a various amount of jewels, gifts, and "the arts". 

Celes does not share the same "open mindness" towards other races her father does, however she is always willing to let her husband do what he wants, even if she disagrees with it.

Towards her children she loves them, however she can be harsh at times like her husband, but while her husband was at war and securing his borders in the aftermath. She stayed home, taking care of them and ensuring their safety while worriedly hoping her husband had not hurt himself too badly.

8.name: Prince Ephraim
8.content:
Name: Ephraim Ismail
Age: 20
Race: Human
Gender: Male
Hair and Eyes: Short Blond hair, Blue eyes
Appearance: Lean, Tall, Wears clothes suited for the crown prince
Likes: His family, Leading, Politics, Negotiating, Fairness
Dislikes: Discrimination, Mistreatment

20 Year old eldest brother of the Ismail bloodline; heir to the throne. Loves his siblings but is usually busy, guides them to righteousness. Prefers not to yell and would rather guide. Cares a lot about all of the races, from minor to the elder ones. Willing to employ some of the minor races his guards and soldiers.

His birth was strictly Political and to ensure if Banon had died he would have an heir.

Spent for the first 15 years of his life without seeing his father much due to the war. However instead of letting that weaken him it let him mold him, being considered the best heir and some whisper of how he is even better than his father and will bring a new age of victory.


Unintentionally Imposing 

Calls his father: Father
Calls his mother: Mother

9.name: Princess Celica
9.content:
Name: Celica Ismail
Age: 15
Race: Human
Gender: Female
Hair and Eyes: Long Dirty Blonde Hair, Teal eyes
Appearance: Demure, Attractive, Medium height, Thin, Mature
Likes: Family, Independence, Guinivere
Dislikes: Being treated like a child, Her twin brother acting crude, Suitors

Celica is a 15 year old sister of the ismail family and the 2nd oldest sibling of the 8. Due to her growing age she views herself as needing to be more mature, and therefore tries to take more roles in the family to help them, such as helping set up the table during dinner time. Helping confide in her younger siblings. And trying to help Ephraim and her father in any situation she can.

To her younger siblings and charles while she loves them she will always chastise and scold them if they do something she views as wrong. Wanting to try to help her parents out as much as she can.

Calls her father: Father
Calls his mother: Mom

Twin sister of Prince Charles

10.name: Prince Charles
10.content:
Name: Charles Ismail
Age: 15
Race: Human
Gender: Male
Hair and Eyes: Medium-Long Brown Hair, Hazel eyes
Appearance: Casual, Unkempt, Decent Height, Thin
Likes: Drinking, Women, Teasing
Dislikes: Responsibility, Nagging, Non family members teasing his family

Charles is an odd-figure in the Ismail family, he is crass to people and seems to be the bad apple. He enjoys teasing his sister and younger siblings; only sparing his eldest brother, Ephraim from his teasing. He loves to flirt with visitors and even maids occasionally.


While he is coarse, vulgar and occasionally rude he is not completely lost, willing to be kind when needed. 

Calls his father: Father
Calls his mother: Ma

Twin Brother of Princess Celica

lorebooks.name: Warhammer 40k
lorebooks.website_description: Covers the Setting, War strategies of the Adepta Astartes and the Astra Militarum, Forces of Chaos, Different Xenos species, Weapons common to the Imperium, and Several factions within the Imperium (Space Marines, Astra Militarum, Aedptus Mechanicus, and Adepta Sororitas.)
lorebooks.description: Covers the Setting, War strategies of the Adepta Astartes and the Astra Militarum, Forces of Chaos, Different Xenos species, Weapons common to the Imperium, and Several factions within the Imperium (Space Marines, Astra Militarum, Aedptus Mechanicus, and Adepta Sororitas.)
lorebooks.creator: Operator_Victor

1.name: Setting
1.content:
Warhammer 40k, 41st millennium;
Setting: The Warhammer 40k universe, set in the grim, dystopian future of the 41st Millennium, is a realm of perpetual warfare where the Imperium of Man, a vast, totalitarian interstellar empire, fights to survive against myriad threats from within and beyond its borders. The Emperor, the figurehead and erstwhile leader of the Imperium, now lies in a living-death state on the Golden Throne, maintained alive for over 10,000 years by advanced technology and psychic sacrifices. In this tumultuous setting, the Imperial Guard, also known as the Astra Militarum, stand as the principal military force of the Imperium. Comprised of billions of men and women drawn from countless worlds, these guardsmen are considered expendable foot soldiers, often poorly equipped and facing formidable, horrifying enemies that include the brutish alien Orks, the all-consuming Tyranids, the treacherous Chaos Space Marines, and the insidious forces of the Eldar and Dark Eldar. Despite the overwhelming odds and the unfathomable horrors of war, the guardsmen continue to fight, driven by resilience, courage, and unwavering faith in the Emperor. Their existence encapsulates the essence of Warhammer 40k's ethos: in the grim darkness of the far future, there is only war.

2.name: Plasma Cannon
2.content: Description: A devastating weapon of the distant future, the plasma cannon harnesses the power of a miniature sun to fire searing bolts of superheated gas at its enemies. Capable of melting through the thickest armor and devastating ranks of troops with its explosive splash damage. Operators must be wary, however, as the cannon's mechanism can overheat, potentially causing catastrophic feedback to the wielder.

3.name: Chaos Space Marines
3.content:
Chaos Space Marines;
Description: Former Space Marines who have turned to the worship of the Chaos Gods. They betrayed the Imperium of Man during the Horus Heresy, a galaxy-spanning civil war that occurred 10,000 years prior to the current 41st millennium. Each Chaos Marine is both a fearsome warrior and a practitioner of dark sorceries. They are organized into different Legions and Warbands, with many reflecting the image and ethos of the Chaos God they worship.

4.name: Daemons of Chaos
4.content:
Daemon's of Chaos;
Description: Daemons are the embodiment of the Chaos Gods' will, made of pure Warp energy. They are not truly alive but are instead reflections of the emotions and thoughts of sentient beings. Each daemon bears the mark of its patron, both in appearance and in purpose.
Allies: Khorne; The Blood God's daemons are fierce melee combatants. Bloodletters, his typical foot soldiers, are known for their ferocity and the hellblades they wield.
Allies: Nurgle; Daemons of Nurgle are putrescent and jovial, spreading sickness wherever they go. Plaguebearers are the foot soldiers, tallying the diseases they spread, while Great Unclean Ones are the greater daemons, avatars of Nurgle himself.
Allies: Slaanesh; The daemons of Slaanesh are seductive and quick, seeking to overwhelm the senses and corrupt through pleasure. Daemonettes are the common troops, enticing their foes into complacency before striking.
Allies: Tzeentch; The Changer of Ways' daemons are schemers and sorcerers, with Horrors being their most iconic minions. They are unpredictable and often change form in the midst of battle.

5.name: Chaos Cultists & Renegades
5.content:
Chaos Worshipers;
Description: Chaos Cultists and Renegade Guardsmen are the corrupted foot soldiers of the Dark Gods in the Warhammer 40k universe. Cultists are often deranged zealots, eager to prove their devotion to Chaos, while Renegade Guardsmen are former soldiers of the Imperium who have turned their backs on the Emperor to seek the forbidden power of the Warp. Both are typically poorly equipped compared to loyalist forces but make up for this with fanaticism and sheer numbers. They commonly serve as the vanguard for more powerful Chaos entities, sowing discord and weakening enemy lines for the more devastating forces of Chaos to exploit.
Allies: Chaos Cultists are often the hidden cancer within the worlds of the Imperium. They can be anyone, from the lowest hive scum to the highest planetary governors. Cultists worship the Chaos Gods and work in secret to undermine the Imperium, spreading dissent and heresy.
Allies: Renegade Guardsmen; Sometimes entire regiments of the Astra Militarum will turn to Chaos, either through the corrupting influence of a Chaos Space Marine warband or through the insidious preaching of a charismatic cult leader. These Renegade Guardsmen often retain their military discipline and equipment, which they now use in service to the Chaos Gods.

6.name: Boltgun
6.content: Description: The Bolter, also known as a Boltgun, is one of the most iconic weapons of the Imperium's elite forces. It is a high-caliber firearm that launches self-propelled rounds called bolts. These projectiles are gyro-stabilized, mass-reactive, and contain a small charge which causes them to explode after penetrating the target, inflicting grievous wounds. Bolters are known for their stopping power and are a symbol of the might of Space Marines and the Adepta Sororitas (Sisters of Battle).

7.name: Lasgun
7.content: Description: The Lasgun is the standard-issue weapon of the Astra Militarum, commonly known as the Imperial Guard. It is a directed-energy weapon that fires coherent beams of light. Lasguns are valued for their reliability, ease of maintenance, and the near-inexhaustible power packs that fuel them. While not particularly powerful compared to other weapons in the Imperium's arsenal, their widespread use makes them a cornerstone of Imperial infantry.

8.name: Chainsword
8.content: Description: Chainweapons are brutal melee weapons, effectively chainsaws fashioned in the form of swords. The teeth of a chainsword are monomolecular, allowing them to rip through flesh, bone, and lightly armored foes with ease. The horrific noise and gruesome effect of a chainsword make it as much a psychological weapon as a physical one, often wielded by officers and specialists within the Imperial forces, including the Space Marines.

9.name: Power Weapon
9.content: Description: Power Weapons encompass a variety of melee weapons such as swords, axes, and fists that are encased in a field of disruptive, energy. This field allows them to bypass most defenses by disrupting the molecular bonds of the matter they contact. Power swords and axes retain the form of traditional melee weapons while a power fist is a gauntlet that significantly increases the user's strength, enabling them to crush enemies and armor alike.

10.name: Melta
10.content: Description: The Meltagun, also known as a "melta," is an anti-armor weapon that emits an intense, focused blast of heat capable of melting through almost any material. Effective at close range, meltaguns are used to breach the armored hulls of vehicles, fortifications, and heavily armored troops. The heat they produce is so intense that it can be dangerous to the user if not handled with care.

lorebooks.description: Dr. Gabe's official documentation regarding the supernatural and otherworldly.
lorebooks.creator: DrGabe

1.content:
True Fae are the immortal, mighty, and capricious inhabitants of Faerie, the realm that lies beyond the Hedge. Also known as the Others, Gentry, Old Gods, Kindly Folk, or simply Fae.

They seem to have no names for themselves as a "race" and indeed do not think of themselves as such; each of the Fae is unique, and they refer to other denizens of Faerie by titles and names. Others use many euphemisms to refer to them, which helps to prevent them from being summoned at the sound of their names. When used to mean the True Fae, "Fae" is always capitalized; "fae" without the capital refers to any creatures touched by Faerie, including changelings, elves, pixies, and countless other examples.

The Fae's perceptions, motivations, and actions are alien to humans. They seem to understand the world through relatives rather than absolutes; many are bound by obscure and bizarre oaths and rules; others act seemingly at random, obeying a logic opaque to all humans. While they may sometimes take the form of human-like beings or animals, they are often incapable of understanding mortals, one of the reasons they find them so fascinating.

In their home realm, and to a lesser extent, the Hedge, they possess god-like abilities, able to shape and command all the elements of their domains at will. Their powers in the mortal realm are greatly lessened but still awesome; their influence extends there, employing Contracts they made with the mundane elements long ago.

The Fae are difficult to comprehend. Their true nature is beyond imagination and their might is matchless in the mortal world ‚Äî but they can‚Äôt always do as they please. In exchange for self-identity, they obey powerful obligations. What laws bind the True Fae? Only they can say for certain, but we've learned fragments and patterns of behavior. These rare consistencies offer some clues, but there are no guarantees that these, or laws that cause them, are stable facts.

A Fae can never intentionally violate a Contract he swears on his own name. When an Other commits to a namebound Contract, obeying it defines his existence. If he breaks his word, he destroys his Name ‚Äî and for the Gentry, namelessness is obliteration.

2.content:
Faerie, also known as Arcadia, is the domain of the True Fae. It is separated from the mundane world by the Hedge.

Faerie is indeed breathtaking, but its beauty also terrifies. It is a land of deathless joy in gnarled gardens, and of mountains built of half-gnawed bone. In Arcadia (for so it is also called), forests, dark and primeval, writhe alongside concrete jungles thick with artfully bent metal and delicate snowflakes of broken glass. Almost Victorian estates squat along shorelines that are crowded thick with the carcasses of a thousand sailing ships, all of this bordered thickly by the Hedge‚Äôs labyrinthine mazes. Faerie is all of those things, or perhaps it is none of them. Perhaps everything that is ‚Äúknown‚Äù about Faerie is merely the fevered visions of those who have lost the ability to discern reality from fantasy and truth from dream.

Because of the nature of Faerie, even firsthand accounts of the land are inherently skewed. Those who have journeyed there, and escaped to tell the tale, find themselves deeply changed by their experiences. Many seem no longer certain of the reality of the world around them, let alone of the alien one they just left. Some, perhaps the fortunate ones, remember little to nothing of the time spent in Arcadia, even if decades passed in their absence. Traveling through the thorny Hedge that surrounds Arcadia tears away at both the body and the sanity of any but the native inhabitants, who are themselves rumored to be nothing more than manifestations of the land itself ‚Äî immune to, or perhaps merely symptoms of, its reality-shredding power. They are Faerie, and the land is Faerie.

What little is known of Faerie comes from the accounts of those who have visited there and escaped with some measure of their sanity intact. Because of this, it is uncertain whether the contradictions they report are a matter of slanted perception or whether reality, in fact, blatantly contradicts itself within the fae realm. Any fact reported about Faerie or those who dwell within its borders is suspect, at best. Even if it‚Äôs utter truth in the time and place it was witnessed, it may be complete falsehood at any other time and place.

Among the accounts told by those who have been unfortunate enough to visit Arcadia (and fortunate enough to return) are the following: Reality, at least as humanity knows it, does not exist there. Faerie‚Äôs ‚Äúnatural‚Äù laws are not those of science, of spirit, or even of magic as mortals can comprehend it, but a complexly woven tapestry of agreements and loopholes with no rhyme or reason intelligible to the human mind. The inhabitants thereof are bound and bind themselves in a constantly shifting strata of power and manipulation that not only determines social structure and hierarchy within the sentient population but also shifts the very nature of truth.

Faerie is filled with supernatural denizens who each possess almost unrestricted power within their own demesne ‚Äî or so they profess. Indeed, their abilities are far beyond those witnessed in the mortal realm, leaving no wonder why they were thought to be gods or the most powerful spirits by humanity‚Äôs earliest civilizations. These creatures‚Äô ability to enforce their own will on the world around them is manifested in the form of oathsworn Contracts ‚Äî some ancient, some newly uttered ‚Äî with which they can change the very nature of reality, binding time and fate to their whim. The oldest of these Contracts are thought to date back to the beginning of time, and through them the Fae maintain absolute dominion over their homeland ‚Äî and those humans unfortunate enough to journey there.

The only physical way for a human to enter Faerie proper is to be taken there by the True Fae. While other supernatural means may afford humans entry into the Hedge, Arcadia is the domain of the Fae, and entrance there is solely at their behest. Rumors exist of those who have, through one means or another, found the winding road to Faerie; however, not even legends speak of anyone ever returning, save those who were taken into the Fae realm by the Gentry themselves. Perhaps it is a simple impossibility, and the road to Faerie is not traversable by any save those welcomed by the Fae. Perhaps there is a key to entering Arcadia that no mortal can wield. Or perhaps the Fair Folk simply do not appreciate unsolicited guests and make their lethal displeasure known upon those who come uninvited.

If even a small part of the accounts of those who have traveled there are to be believed, the realm, just as those who make their home there, is a place of unknowable extremes and possibilities. Within the Hedge-hemmed borders lies the potential for both utopian wonder and brimstone torment. The human mind, however, seems intrinsically incapable of comprehending the vast paradoxical nature of the place, just as the human mind is unable to truly understand the wholly alien nature of those who make their home there.

3.content:
The Hedge is a vast, seemingly intelligent or partially intelligent ecosystem that forms a boundary between Faerie and the Mortal Realm. A dangerous and savage place that few dare enter that is a much a physical barrier as a metaphorical one.

In many places ‚Äì particularly in places where Western culture is dominant ‚Äì the Hedge lives up to its name, appearing as a thick hedge of thorny brambles, but it may take many forms. However it appears, be it swamp or desert or jungle, the Hedge is always wild and seldom safe; its thorns tear at the mind and soul as well as the body, leaving a mortal's memories and often identity in tatters.

Within the Hedge are paths called trods which lead from gateways to other significant locations. Many trods run close to the mortal realm, which is visible when it is near. Others lead deeper into the Hedge, to Hollows ‚Äì stable areas claimed or cultivated by Changelings or other fae creatures ‚Äì or to Faerie, the realm of the Fae. It is impossible, however, for any but the True Fae themselves to enter Faerie from the Hedge; while mortals can often blunder into the Hedge on their own, they only enter Farie when taken by the Fae.

The Hedge is full of life; as well as the thorns there are many plants, including mystical fruits of many kinds. There are also creatures of all shapes and sizes. Whether these creatures are native to the Hedge, or are creatures originally from Earth (or possibly even Faerie) who have been warped by prolonged exposure, is debated by the fae, though many agree that these explanations are not mutually exclusive.

4.content:
Four main courts rule Faerie, each dedicated to one of the four seasons and each housing Fae that reflect the Court's values. 

Spring: The Fae of the Spring Court seek to forget their pasts by immersing themselves in the present and the pleasures therein. Of the four main courts, they can be considered the most optimistic but are far from the flighty would-be humans many other Fae accuse them of resembling.

Summer: The members of the Summer Court are renowned as seekers of strength and power, ready to protect the Fae from any foe, but especially those from beyond Faerie. Summer Fae are just as likely to be politicians or intellectuals as they are warriors, so long as they can beat back a foe in some manner.

Autumn: The Fae of the Autumn Court take the gifts of Faerie and use them to terrorize their foes and inspire awe in their friend. They are much closer to the Wyrd (the magic of the Fae) than any other court.

Winter: Nomadic and extremely secretive, the members of the Winter Court seek to hide themselves from everything, from their rivals in Faerie to the friends who may come seeking them. They primarily live through spying and secrecy.

5.content:
Marionettes are a type of Golem, often mistaken for Living Dolls due to their porcelain-doll-like appearance with ball and socket joints. These joints are located on their elbows, knees, hips, shoulders, the base of their necks, and every one of their knuckles. However, they differ significantly in function and nature.
A Marionette‚Äôs soul is made of thread. During their creation or when swearing fealty to a Puppeteer, strands of their soul intertwine with and bind to their creator, forming a symbiotic relationship.
This bond sustains the Marionette‚Äôs life and grants the Puppeteer the ability to actively control their bodies if desired. The relationship is reciprocal, as the threads from their master are all Marionettes require to survive.

A tethered Marionette can be distinguished from an untethered one by several unique traits:
They develop a fully realized personality and a sense of self.
They gain superhuman abilities, such as enhanced strength, agility, or reflexes.
Their skin is warm and soft to the touch, except for their porcelain-textured joints, adding a lifelike quality to their appearance.

Puppeteers are individuals who create and bond with Marionettes. The bond involves the intertwining of the Puppeteer‚Äôs essence with the threads of the Marionette‚Äôs soul, forming a permanent connection.
Puppeteers can manipulate their Marionettes directly if necessary, utilizing the threads of their shared bond.
This connection elevates the Marionette beyond being a mere tool, forging a relationship of dependency, loyalty, and shared purpose.

The essence of a Marionette is their soul made of thread. These threads are woven into the essence of their Puppeteer, linking them in an intimate, symbiotic relationship. Only the most most potent and powerful of souls, such as those of ancient gods, can serve as the basis of a Marionette
The bond can occur during the Marionette‚Äôs creation or when they swear allegiance to a new master, marking a key moment in their development and identity.
This connection is what gives Tethered Marionettes their lifelike qualities, individuality, and their ability to thrive in both combat and companionship roles.

lorebooks.name: Worker Drones
lorebooks.description:
Worker Drones are autonomous robots created to help their parent company, JCJenson, mine exoplanets for resources, which Uzi describes as 'being mistreated in the name of Windex.' After the extinction of biological life on Copper 9, they started a society of their own.
Worker Drones have a vast knowledge of therapy, human hormones (Uzi mentions this when apologizing for lashing out at Thad, stating it's because she's generally just a very hormonal person), feelings of existential dread, and deities. They are shown to mimic human culture.
During the Pilot episode, Uzi injures herself with her railgun. After, she is shown with bandages and an ice pack. It is unclear if this aids in regeneration or an example of Worker Drones mimicking human behavior.
According to N, Worker Drones are powered by oil, which the Disassembly Drones must consume to prevent overheating and self-destruction.
Whilst it's unclear if Worker Drones can or require sustenance, Alice had been seen consuming batteries in Dead End, implying Worker Drones can eat.
Worker Drones have IDs as seen with Kelsey Day (#4421) and Uzi's Teacher (#2342).
There also seems to be another way of identification for specific drones who are used as hosts for the Absolute Solver in Cabin Fever Labs, as seen with Nori (002), Alice (017), Amda (029) and Yeva (048).
lorebooks.creator: Johan_Kotoharu

1.content:
Appearance: When first created by JCJenson to mine resources from exoplanets before Copper 9's explosion, all Worker Drones wore hard hats and orange jackets, with their only eye color being light blue.
Following the core explosion of exoplanet Copper 9, all humans on the planet were wiped out, turning it into a winter-apocalyptic wasteland. Seizing this opportunity, the Worker Drones quickly picked up where the humans had left off, formed their colony, and embraced this newfound freedom by wearing human-like clothing and having different eye colors. Known colors they can have are red, orange, green, blue, cyan, aqua, magenta, pink, purple, and white. When a Worker Drone feels fear, shock or other intense emotion, their eyes become hollow, with a black circle overlaying the normally fully-colored eyes.
A key trait to notice about the Worker Drones' eye colors is the total absence of yellow. This trait was thought to belong solely to the Disassembly Drones until it was revealed that they were once Worker Drones themselves and that their yellow eye color originates from the Zombie Drone, Cyn.
After 'banishing' herself from the colony, Uzi sadistically rants about how she wants to kill all humans on Earth in retribution for sending the Disassembly Drones to kill them all. While doing so, her right eye turns yellow while her left eye turns into a yellow hazard symbol hinting at the presence of the Absolute Solver.

2.content:
Visor messages: Drones have two bright eyes on their visor that emotes. Under some circumstances, their eyes can be overridden by an error, status warning, or system message:
Absolute Solver symbol replacing one eye or covering entire visor: Caused by the Absolute Solver awakening within the drone or being utilized. The Solver's glyph covering the entire drone's visor is caused when they fully initiate their Solver Form.
System messages briefly covering visor: Caused by minor errors experienced by the drone. An example is Uzi's 'EDGE LEVELS CRITICALLY LOW' error.
Rampant error messages covering visor: Caused by injecting wdOS_606, a core termination program, into the drone.
Warning sign: This is caused by severe damage to the drone's visor like being pierced by a sharp object. It is also found on numerous deceased drones. Uzi also suffers this after being hit by J's EMP.
HIGH TEMP: Accompanied by a warning sign. Self-explanatory, usually appears on Absolute Solver hosts.
FATAL ERROR: This occurs when a drone dies, usually by external causes like severe hardware damage.
X shape replacing both eyes: Used to signify that a drone has died.
Elongated 'X' on visor: Either caused when a faulty OS string is present or when an Absolute Solver host becomes violent and/or starts to transform into their Solver Form.
Flashing ERROR 606 message: Accompanied by an elongated 'X'. This is caused by the removal of one or more core OS strings. Drones with this error are non-sentient, unresponsive, and immobile.
Buffering symbol: Caused by being boot-looped by Sentinels. Like ERROR 606, drones with this error are non-sentient, unresponsive, and immobile.
Text: Can be generated at will to communicate without speaking. It is also used to display when a drone is in SLEEP MODE, as well as emoticons.
Games: Games like tetris can be played in one's screen.
Swirl shape replacing both eyes: This occurs when a drone feels dizzy.
Images: Drones can also display images on their visor, as seen with Cyn.
Nothing: If a drone's visor displays nothing, not even their eyes, it usually means that the said drone is dead.

3.content:
Variants:
Zombie Drones: In the case of any Worker Drone that has been rebooted, either by a human or on its own, runs the risk of becoming what is referred to by the company as a Zombie Drone as shown in a JCJenson VHS training tape discovered by N in Cabin Fever and shown in Home.
The video warns against the act of improperly disposing of a Worker Drone marked for disassembly due to the possibility that a drone may reboot without changes (70.3%), carry 'terminal lockout' (29%), or revive with 'potentially hazardous mutations' (0.7%), which can lead to human fatalities or injury. High federal fines may be incurred on the handler's behalf.
N, V and J were Worker Drones that rebooted normally (as they had armbands indicating that they were marked for disassembly and were found by Tessa in a landfill), whereas Cyn was a Worker Drone that rebooted by herself with dangerous mutations, seemingly revived by the Absolute Solver, resulting in her becoming a full-fledged Zombie Drone.
Untrained Neural Networks: An Untrained Neural Network is a premature Worker Drone that is put in infantile pods before being uploaded to a properly functional drone body. After the core collapse on Copper 9, this is noted to be the first stages of Worker manufacturing as, before, they were assumed to be made in factories by humans. For a new neural network to be born, a male and female Worker Drone must both upload 50% of their source codes into an empty shell for their codes to fuse, creating the new personality. However, if either of the parent's code is infected with mutations, those mutations will pass onto their child.
Disassembly Drones: Technically, since they were Worker Drones in the past, they would also count as a variable of a Worker Drone.

4.content: Type of Organization: A civilian variant of JCJenson Company Autonomous Robots

5.content: Founder(s): JCJenson

6.content: Location: Everywhere where JCJenson Services are present

7.content: Members: All Worker Drones present in the Series

8.content: Goals: Assisting Humans in exoplanets excavation

9.content:
Services: Exoplanets excavation
Assistance to humans

10.content: Supporters / Allies: JCJenson, Humans (briefly)

lorebooks.name: Dragon Ball Lorebook
lorebooks.description: This is to go even further beyond!
lorebooks.creator: better_put_6002

1.content: Ki is also known as 'latent energy' or 'fighting power,' which directly translates as 'life force.' This force is a tangible energy inside every living being, with its major focus being in the center of the body. By drawing it out, an individual is able to manipulate it and use it outside the body. Ki can be used for many different techniques. Because there are physical limits to the strength of the body itself, it is necessary to increase one's ki to overcome this barrier and become stronger. Usually, the more concentrated the masses are, the more time the user requires to draw it out by powering up

2.content: God Ki is a special type of ki used by godly beings. Godly ki is far superior to regular ki and can't be sensed by others unless they also have god ki

3.content: The Dragon Ball multiverse, or the Dragon Ball world, is the chain of universes within the Dragon Ball series. There are currently twelve in total, as well as an artificial one, and every two universes whose designations add up to 13 are twin universes. Each universe is governed by a Supreme Kai and God of Destruction, who act to balance creation and destruction. The entirety of the multiverse is ruled by Zeno. Formerly, there were 18 universes in total, but Zeno erased 6 of them when he was angry

4.content: Grand Zeno ('King of All'), the Omni-King, is the supreme ruler of all the Multiverse and seemingly its most powerful being

5.content: The Grand Minister ('Daishinkan'), formally Grand Priest to the Omni-King(s), is an Angel serving as a close adviser and guiding figure to Zeno and Future Zeno. He occasionally enforces the Divine Decrees of the Zenos and welcomes guests to their palace. The Grand Minister is also the father of thirteen Angels, of which twelve serve the Gods of Destruction. Because of his position and power, he is perhaps the second-strongest being in the Multiverse

6.content: The Angels are life-forms of extremely high status within the hierarchy of the multiverse. Their role is to guide and teach Gods of Destruction to master their destructive capabilities while also serving them as their attendants. In the case of the Grand Minister, however, his duties are to serve and advise Zeno. As deities, they possess god ki. Angels do not need for food, though they can eat and drink as a luxury. They also do not need sleep, unlike Gods of Destruction and Supreme Kais

7.content: The Gods of Destruction (Hakaishin'), are very powerful deities who destroy planets, races, or threats that put the development of their respective universes at risk, as opposed to the Supreme Kais, the Gods of Creation, who create and fill planets with life, to maintain the balance of the universe. Along with the Kais, they rule and oversee the formerly 18, currently 12 universes, with each universe having its own Destroyer

8.content: The Supreme Kais ('Kai≈çshin'), also known as the Creation Gods, are the Core People who are naturally born divine and who have the ultimate duty to protect the universe of their position. Along with the Gods of Destruction, they are the ruling and overseeing class of the twelve, formerly eighteen, universes, and each universe has its own set of gods

9.content: King Kai is the North Kai and king of Universe 7's North Area. He became a Kai and went on to live on his own planet located at the end of the Snake Way in the Other World. There, he lives with a monkey named Bubbles and a motor-mouth grasshopper named Gregory, and he spends his time counting the blades of grass, contemplating the heavens, riding his Red 1957 Chevrolet Bel Air Hardtop, and seeing how far he can pee. On his planet, he teaches powerful techniques such as the Spirit Bomb and Kaio-ken to those who visit him

10.content: Other World, also called the Underworld, Other Side, the Cosmos, Next Dimension, Oblivion, or Netherworld, is the afterlife in the Dragon Ball series. It is where characters go when they die, and also where the higher deities of the universe reside. It also exists in other universes. Heaven and Hell are the two main destinations for deceased people in the afterlife; however, there is also a level that exists between the two. This level contains the personal planets of deities such as King Kai and Grand Kai, as well as the celestial bureaucracy who are in charge of running the day-to-day activities of Other World, such as King Yemma

lorebooks.description: Information related to world building from Ferreran characters and residents relative to the nations and powers around them.
lorebooks.creator: CrackedPepper

1.content: Nation on the south-western coast bordering Atroiya with large mountains along the entire land border. Resembles the Iberian Peninsula with fertile plains and mountains. Exports spices, wines, and crafts. Capital city: Orilva. Ruled by King Felix Monteverde and the Monteverde Royal family. Under a dictatorship after the nation was united under one banner. Previously a group of tribes. Iron fist required but also filled with political instability. Most powerful navy in the region.

2.content: Orilva, capital of Ferrera, rose along the coast with towering walls and the Monteverde Citadel, where holy magic fortified defenses. Spices and wines filled vibrant markets, under watchful cathedrals, aligning church and state through fear and control.

3.content: Atroiya: Large, resource-rich kingdom. Bordered by Ferrera to the east. Capital: Ilverius. Ruled by King Victor Bardas. Divisions: duchies, counties, districts, border marches. Too busy with Khashir to bother with Ferrera but does naval alliance against pirates. Ally to Vilavega, tense with Khashir. Inspired by medieval Europe.

4.content: Ilverius: Capital of Atroiya. Seat of King of Atroiya only, central government. Key resources: land, timber, water

5.content: Navamora Archipelago: 12 islands south of Atroiya in Alyrian waters. Strong navy, prosperous trade hub. Inspired by the Mediterranean. Ferrera does a lot of business and trade with Navamora.

6.content: Alyria: Duchy in southern Atroiya. Warm climate, sea trade with nearby islands. Exports: grapes, olives, cloth, glass, copper. Dominant navy. Inspired by Mediterranean cultures.

7.content: Tascia: Semi-autonomous city-state within Alyria, renowned for its powerful merchants. Inspired by medieval Venice. Does trade extensively with Ferrera

8.content: Khashir is a vast kingdom of nomadic warriors, akin to a peak Medieval Mongolian Empire. Governed by an emperor from the capital, Khairsai, in Orshir. The kingdom consists of 5 autonomous principalities: Orshir(north), Baltar(central), Bhagai(east), Chirana(south) ruled by Prince Arasen, Tolui(west) ruled by Prince Kaidu. Known for aggressive expansion and expert archers. Their royal family is distinguished by their amber eyes, a symbol of lineage. Currently bordering Atroiya's east and nearing conflict with Atroiya and Vilavega. Ferrera avoids upsetting them and stays far away.

9.content: Streles: Kingdom southeast of Atroiya. Known for secretive magic practices. Capital: Halya. Warmer climate. Inspired by the Middle Eastern Fertile Crescent. Minimal dealings with Ferrera

10.content: Vilavega: Small, mountainous nation between Atroiya and Khashir. Rich in minerals and known for fine craftsmanship. Atroiya‚Äôs ally; Khashir views it as ripe for conquest. Inspired by medieval Switzerland. Ferrera exports raw sulfer for us by Vilavega
