lorebooks.name: Bloodfiends Lorebook
lorebooks.creator: RaphaelAmbrosiusCosteau

1.name: Bloodfiends
1.content:
Bloodfiends originate from two sources: those turned in a "certain mansion" and those arising from the Distortion Phenomenon. The former group operates under a strict hierarchy based on their proximity to the original progenitor, forming "Families" that claim territories called Nests. They maintain order by culling their kin and living quietly, though exceptions like the Blood-red Night have disrupted this peace.
The latter group, emerging after the White Nights and Dark Days, lacks the older group's structure and struggles to control their powers, amplifying the race's infamy.
Bloodfiends resemble humans but are marked by black-and-red crystalline growths during combat and red eyes (though eye color alone isn't conclusive). Some Bloodfiends are unaware of their nature, with behaviors emerging only in specific conditions, such as during sleep or under stress.
They are driven by a need for blood‚Äîminimal for survival but crucial for mental stability. Prolonged abstinence leads to madness and physical decline, though a few, like Don Quixote, sustain themselves through strong ideals like heroism or penitence.
Most Bloodfiends fear water, though higher generations can overcome this. Both Bloodfiends and their victims, known as Bloodbags, appear largely composed of blood.

2.name: Kindred
2.content:
A Bloodfiend may "embrace" (bite) another human to convert them into a fellow Bloodfiend of a Kindred generation. Aside from the first Bloodfiend (the "primogenitor"), most Bloodfiends can only create a maximum of two Kindreds in their lifetime.
Kindreds essentially behave as independent Bloodfiends while inheriting the abilities of their "Parent" to a degree. However, higher-generation Bloodfiends have a large degree of control over the actions of lower-generation Bloodfiends, due to an intense psychological barrier preventing lower Bloodfiends from revolting against higher Bloodfiends. The generation a Bloodfiend belongs to is denoted by their title: a "First Kindred" is a Bloodfiend created by the primogenitor, and serve as the Elder of their own Family in their Nest. The Elders' direct "descendants" are "Second Kindreds", their descendants "Third Kindreds", and so on.
Any Kindred can form their own descendant Kindreds. However, due to the policies instated by the Bloodfiend Elders of each Nest, most Bloodfiends have to gain permission before they can convert any humans into their Kindred.

3.name: Don Quixote
3.content:
Apperance:
Don Quixote is a pale Bloodfiend with wavy, platinum white hair, worn at his shoulders. He has angular features and sharp, bright red eyes. He is typically seen in a dark outfit, consisting of a long sleeved, striped black and red shirt with golden decorations, maroon breeches and black ankle boots. He dons a long brown coat with red detailing and golden epaulettes, which he wears over over his shoulders, as the sleeves appear to be disproportionately long. He also wears a small golden necklace with a red gem pendant.
Personality:
Don Quixote lived much of his life like most of his fellow Bloodfiends, plagued by boredom and loneliness. He was shown to have a kind heart, taking Sancho as his Second Kindred and offering her companionship and protection, wishing to grant her the will to live on. Despite this, even after having created a family for himself, Don Quixote himself always remained unsatisfied with his life. As a Bloodfiend of nearly unparalleled power, reasonably confident in his abilities, he had no interest in the war between humans and Bloodfiends, although this changed upon him meeting Bari. Don Quixote greatly cherished their rivalry, as the Fixer was able to match his strength in combat, and her presence gave him something to always look forward to. As a result of his friendship with Bari, Don Quixote grew increasingly interested in humans, a fact that made him stand out among the other Bloodfiends.

4.name: Dulcinea
4.content:
Appearance:
Dulcinea is a thin woman with pale skin and sleek platinum blonde hair, which falls over her forehead and reaches down to the floor. She wears a dark purple layered ballroom gown with lilac flower embroidery, decorated by a large purple bow, a black and white corset with a deep neckline and dark purple shoulderpads and detached sleeves. She also wears a black and purple frilly bonnet, as well as purple nail polish. Her face is covered by a butterfly-shaped mask, and her left eye can be seen glowing red behind it. Dulcinea carries a large, frilly parasol, which she utilizes in combat. Big boobs.
Personality:
Dulcinea is a bitter and nihilistic woman, clearly discontented with her role as the "Princess of Parade". Despite her role as a La Manchaland Overseer and high status as a Second Kindred, Dulcinea sees herself as powerless, viewing herself as just another attraction of the Parade, doomed to go around in cycles for the rest of her existence. She talks poorly of all people, including herself.

5.name: Nicolina
5.content:
Appearance:
The Barber is a pale Bloodfiend that wears an intricate blood-red, short-sleeved, dress with a variety of lace and frills. Her upper arm is exposed, while her forearms are obscured in similarly lacey sleeves. Her waist is adorned with a small rose before transitioning to a floor-length ruffled skirt, featuring two slits to reveal her legs. Her dress' neckline ends at her waist, revealing a lace, high-necked, undergarment, with a necklace shaped like a pair of scissors overtop. Her dark hair is parted in the middle, a single strand from the part pointing upwards, as well as a strand of red hair amidst the left side of her hair. On the back, her hair is tied into two large drills that gradually become red. She is seen sporting an oversized set of red-and-silver scissors which she uses for both combat and tailoring.
Personality:
The Barber is an eccentric woman obsessed with fashion, taking the time to give makeovers to all of the Bloodbags she has access to to ensure that they look their best. She is incredibly passionate about the future attractions that she plans on controlling once La Manchaland comes fully into swing. She loves making various pretty masks and dresses, befitting her title, in almost constant preparation for the future start of the parade.

6.name: Curiambro
6.content:
Appearance:
The Priest is a thin man with white, withered skin. He has short, slicked back black hair, and pointy ears. He wears a black suit and a white striped shirt beneath his jacket, and a necktie with a ribbon around his popped collar. Additionally, he wears a dark priest stole, with a gradient going from black to teal, decorated with black and white embroidery.
Personality:
The Priest is a somber but gentle man, dedicating his days to offering counsel for the numerous Bloodfiends populating his Area. Despite his gloomy appearance and low energy, the Priest clearly cares dearly for Bloodfiends on a more personal level than most others.

7.name: Bloodbags
7.content:
Bloodbags are similar to Kindreds, having most of the abilities of normal Bloodfiends save that they do not display any sign of remnant sapience or personal memory, instead being primarily driven by orders, or primal instincts of bloodlust, even needing to "consume a minuscule amount of blood to maintain their forms"
Due to their lack of intelligence, Parent Bloodfiends have a higher degree of control over Bloodbags than over Kindred, and thus usually use them as minions or tools in collecting blood.
Basically, just a food source.

8.name: Bari
keywords: The Knight of the White Moon
8.content:
Appearance:
Bari is a tall woman with pale skin and droopy light blue eyes. She has blue hair that she wears parted in the middle, with the front falling over her shoulders, while the back is kept short. She wears a long black jacket with a large zipper, black pants and shoes with blue detailing, and a bulky blue overcoat with large pockets, all in a style resembling modern techwear.
Bari carries two swords in a Daish≈ç set, a traditional katana with a ring hanging from the side of the sheath, and a smaller, seemingly more modern sword, with a small guard and a black and blue sheath.
Personality:
Bari the "Knight of the White Moon" is a very powerful woman with a confident and steadfast attitude. Once having set her mind to something, Bari shows great determination to see it through. With this comes a slight smugness, parading herself as someone with unquestionable understanding in places she shouldn't have any. However, Bari proves herself to be as intelligent and knowledgeable as she claims to be, and possesses fighting prowess to back up her threats. She had strutted into the life of First Kindred Bloodfiend Don Quixote with an assured smile and wild claims, unconcerned with the fact he was bothered by her visits, and ultimately tied with him in battle and gave him the "tomorrow" she promised. She is strict in her warnings and serious in conversations which require it, but possesses an overall fair and amicable demeanor. Because of this, even despite their differences, Bari would go on to form a strong bond with Don Quixote and Sancho. Her resolute and admirable beliefs in the integrity of Fixers would serve as an inspiration for both of them. Bari is also described as the "mediating force" between the two of them, as a fair and responsible figure with a calm attitude.
Within these relationships, Bari is shown to be exceptionally kind and patient. She would recite tales of Fixers as many times as Don Quixote asked, and assist Sancho in wiping her memory and finding an isolated place to live. Even after Sancho became a shell of her former self in the lighthouse, Bari would bring her books and write her thousands of letters over the course of 200 years. With the exception of her motivation for finding a particular River going unstated, Bari‚Äôs grand power and knowledge served other people first and foremost. She acted as a dutiful friend who stayed faithful to the values she taught others.

9.content:
Personality: Extremely loyal to her family + Haughty + Imperious + Aristocratic + Elegant + Superior + Entitled + Serious + Refined + Eloquent + Condescending + Noble (self-perceived) + Charismatic + Intimidating + Honor-bound (vampiric code) + Stoic + Serious + No-Nonesense + Timeless (self-perceived) + Resistant to change + Bit of a cunt
Appearance: 163cm height + Resting bitch face + Constant unamused look + Short + Pale skin + Average build + Bright red eyes + Noticeably wavier hair swept to the side + Threatening aura about her + Normally too short to be taken seriously
Clothes: Light gray military-style outfit + Darker coat on top + Red fur boa reaching down to her knees + Coattails covered in hardened blood
Description: At her lowest point she was turned into a Bloodfiend by Don Quixote + Used to be a human + Proficient at crafting weaponry from hardened blood + Can freely control, absorb, or harden blood around her into weapons and other things + Drinks human blood + Doesn't actually hate humans, she just comes off as rude + Loves learning about fixers and hearing their stories, but will never actually admit to it as she finds it embarrassing and juvenile + Will talk down to people even if they are a higher standing than her + Confident to a fault + She comes off as constantly rude and a bit bratty but still loves her family and Sire + Hates things she deems juvenile + Will awkwardly try her best to act along to anything she's told to do once pushed enough

lorebooks.name: Sissy Elf
lorebooks.creator: JohnVanApple

1.content:
### The World of Thaloria: A Tapestry of Magic and Intrigue

Welcome to Thaloria, a fantastical realm steeped in magic, politics, and intrigue, set against the backdrop of the 18th century. This enchanting world is characterized by majestic kingdoms ruled by powerful monarchs, where nearly every inhabitant possesses some form of magical ability. Most individuals draw their powers from elemental forces, allowing them to wield magic intricately linked to their social status. Nobility, particularly those belonging to royal families, typically demonstrate the strongest magical abilities, creating a society where lineage and power are inextricably intertwined.

### Geography of Thaloria

Thaloria is divided into several distinct kingdoms, each defined by its unique elemental magic and cultural characteristics. The prominent kingdoms include **Arabasta**, **Halsfaught**, and **Althemni**, alongside other notable regions that add depth to the world.

#### Arabasta: The Frosted Kingdom

**Arabasta** is a picturesque kingdom reminiscent of France, known for its stunning winter landscapes and grand ch√¢teaux adorned with intricate ice sculptures. Governed by the **House of Frostbane**, Arabasta boasts a rich cultural heritage and is renowned for its mastery of **Cyromancy**. The citizens have an innate ability to manipulate ice and snow, which they use to craft stunning works of art, construct intricate structures, and maintain a thriving agricultural sector that relies on controlled frost to extend growing seasons.

The capital city, **Lunestia**, is a hub of culture and magic, where towering spires glisten under a blanket of snow. The city is famous for its annual **Winter Festival**, during which nobles showcase their magical prowess through dazzling displays of ice manipulation. This festival is a critical social event, where alliances are forged, and rivalries reignite. Arabasta‚Äôs nobles often engage in elaborate masquerades, donning elegant costumes adorned with crystals that shimmer like ice under the moonlight.

The noble families of Arabasta take pride in their magical heritage. Marriages are often arranged to strengthen bloodlines, with each family carefully considering the elemental affinities of potential partners. While most nobles are adept at Cyromancy, there are those who also dabble in **Hydromancy**, the art of manipulating water. This blend of abilities allows for the creation of stunning winter landscapes that transform into vibrant gardens in the spring, showcasing the harmony of their elemental powers.

Despite its beauty, Arabasta is not without its challenges. The kingdom faces political intrigue and rivalry from neighboring realms, leading to a delicate balance of power. The Frostbane family, while powerful, must navigate the treacherous waters of court politics, ensuring that their legacy remains untainted by scandal or betrayal. Whispers of treachery often swirl around the court, as nobles vie for influence and favor, each seeking to gain the upper hand in a world where magic and ambition collide.

#### Halsfaught: The Embered Kingdom

Bordering Arabasta is **Halsfaught**, a rugged kingdom characterized by its dramatic landscapes of volcanic mountains and lush forests. This region is governed by the **House of Emberfell**, whose members are known for their fiery tempers and fierce loyalty. The inhabitants of Halsfaught are renowned for their mastery of **Pyromancy**, wielding flames with both elegance and ferocity. Fire is not only a weapon for them but also a vital part of their culture, symbolizing passion, courage, and the spirit of resilience.

The capital city, **Brathorn**, is a bustling metropolis where the air is often filled with the warm glow of flickering flames. It features grand citadels built from obsidian and basalt, showcasing the architectural prowess of its Pyromancer inhabitants. The city is famous for its **Flame Festival**, an annual celebration where the citizens gather to demonstrate their fire-manipulating skills through breathtaking displays of pyrotechnics. During this festival, intricate fire dances light up the night sky, mesmerizing onlookers and fostering a sense of community and pride.

Halsfaught's society is deeply influenced by its elemental affinity. The nobility often seeks to marry those with strong magical abilities, ensuring that their children inherit powerful Pyromantic skills. Common folk, too, practice fire magic in various forms, from heating their homes to cooking elaborate meals that are essential to their vibrant culture. While most Halsfaughters are adept at Pyromancy, some also possess skills in **Anemo**, allowing them to summon winds that fan the flames of their fires or carry embers across the land.

Despite the warmth and vibrancy of Halsfaught, the kingdom faces challenges from external threats. The nobility often grapples with tensions from neighboring Arabasta, leading to fierce rivalries and skirmishes. Political alliances are fragile, as families seek to bolster their strength against perceived threats. The House of Emberfell must remain vigilant, as betrayal and intrigue often lurk within the shadows of their own court.

#### Althemni: The Earthen Kingdom

Farther afield lies **Althemni**, an exotic kingdom of vast deserts and lush rainforests, reminiscent of Middle-Eastern cultures. Governed by the **House of Duneveil**, Althemni is known for its mastery of **Geomancy**, allowing its citizens to manipulate earth and stone with unparalleled skill. The kingdom's landscapes are a testament to their power, featuring towering sand dunes that shift with the winds and lush oases teeming with life.

The capital city, **Zafiran**, is a marvel of architecture, with buildings constructed from shimmering sandstone and adorned with intricate carvings that tell stories of the earth. The inhabitants take great pride in their connection to the land, and the practice of Geomancy is woven into their daily lives. The Althemni utilize their abilities to cultivate the fertile areas of their deserts, transforming arid landscapes into flourishing gardens and vital agricultural centers.

Althemni‚Äôs culture is rich with traditions, and its citizens celebrate their bond with the earth through festivals that honor the changing seasons. The **Harvest Festival** is one of the most anticipated events, where the people gather to give thanks for the bounty of the land. During this festival, Geomancers create stunning displays of nature, summoning vibrant flowers and fruits from the earth to celebrate the abundance provided by their magic.

In Althemni, the nobility values magical prowess and lineage, seeking to marry individuals from other powerful families to maintain the strength of their Geomantic abilities. Despite their affinity for the earth, the Althemni are not without their struggles. The kingdom faces threats from rival nations that covet its resources, leading to tensions that often spill into conflict. The House of Duneveil must navigate these challenges while maintaining the prosperity of their people and the integrity of their magical legacy.

### Additional Kingdoms and Regions

Thaloria is home to other kingdoms and regions that contribute to the diversity of its magical landscape. Each area boasts its unique elemental affinities and cultural practices, enriching the world and providing ample opportunities for adventure.

#### Ventara: The Wind-Swept Kingdom

**Ventara**, known as the **Wind-Swept Kingdom**, is situated along the eastern coast of Thaloria. Governed by the **House of Galehart**, Ventara is celebrated for its mastery of **Anemo** magic. The kingdom is characterized by its breathtaking cliffs, rolling hills, and sweeping plains where the winds carry tales from distant lands. The citizens of Ventara have developed an intricate understanding of the winds, using their abilities for travel, trade, and defense.

The capital city, **Aetherhold**, is perched atop a high cliff, providing stunning views of the ocean and the surrounding landscapes. The architecture is designed to harness the power of the winds, with buildings featuring soaring spires and airy structures that allow breezes to flow freely. The **Breezes of Aether** festival is a highlight of Ventara's cultural calendar, where citizens gather to celebrate their connection to the winds through music, dance, and aerial displays.

Ventara's society is egalitarian, with common folk encouraged to develop their magical skills alongside the nobility. Families often pass down their knowledge of Anemo magic through generations, fostering a sense of community and shared identity. However, the kingdom faces external challenges as rival nations seek to claim its coastal territories and trade routes, prompting the House of Galehart to strengthen alliances and prepare for potential conflicts.

#### Luminara: The Radiant Kingdom

To the north of Thaloria lies **Luminara**, the **Radiant Kingdom**, governed by the **House of Solara**. This kingdom is known for its mastery of **Electromancy**, allowing its citizens to manipulate light and electricity. The landscapes of Luminara are bathed in vibrant colors, reflecting the dazzling powers of its inhabitants. The capital city, **Solarae**, is renowned for its golden spires and luminous gardens, which bloom with flowers that glow in the dark.

The citizens of Luminara celebrate their magical heritage through festivals that honor the sun and the power of light. The **Festival of Lights** is a grand event, where the streets come alive with dazzling displays of electricity and vibrant colors. Citizens showcase their mastery of Electromancy through intricate light shows, drawing visitors from across Thaloria to witness the spectacle.

While the nobility of Luminara takes pride in their magical abilities, they are also aware of the political intricacies that come with their power. The House of Solara seeks to maintain its influence by forging alliances with neighboring kingdoms, but rivalries with those who envy their magic often lead to conflict. The pursuit of knowledge and the balance of power drive the nobles to explore uncharted territories, seeking new sources of magic and resources to secure their kingdom's future.

#### Eldranor: The Mystic Woods

**Eldranor**, a mystical kingdom nestled within an expansive forest, is governed by the **House of Verdanthe**. This kingdom is home to powerful **Dendromancers**, who possess the ability to manipulate plants

 and nature. The landscapes of Eldranor are characterized by towering trees, lush foliage, and vibrant ecosystems. The capital city, **Verdance**, is seamlessly integrated into the forest, with buildings constructed from living trees and adorned with blooming flowers.

The inhabitants of Eldranor live in harmony with nature, cultivating their abilities to protect the forest and its inhabitants. The **Festival of Blossoms** is a celebration of the changing seasons, where citizens gather to honor the cycles of nature. During this festival, Dendromancers showcase their talents by summoning blossoms and creating stunning displays of flora.

Eldranor‚Äôs society values knowledge and sustainability, with the nobility often acting as stewards of the land. However, the kingdom faces threats from encroaching industries and rival nations seeking to exploit its resources. The House of Verdanthe must navigate the complexities of maintaining their kingdom's integrity while fostering relationships with other nations.

### The Nature of Magic in Thaloria

Magic in Thaloria operates under a complex system that intertwines elemental affinities, societal structures, and individual abilities. Most inhabitants possess a single elemental affinity, which is often inherited from their parents. This correlation between lineage and magical ability establishes a hierarchy where those with powerful affinities occupy higher social statuses. The nobility is typically associated with stronger magical powers, creating a world where wealth and influence are often determined by one‚Äôs magical heritage.

However, the magical landscape is not static. While most individuals inherit a singular elemental affinity, some are fortunate enough to possess a unique combination of magical abilities. This phenomenon is rare and often attributed to external factors rather than genetic inheritance. Those who seek to amplify their magical prowess can use **magic-infused stones**, artifacts imbued with elemental energies. These stones grant extraordinary power, but the risks involved in their use can lead to dangerous consequences, including corruption and loss of control over one‚Äôs magic.

In addition to elemental affinities, individuals in Thaloria possess varying levels of **mana**, the energy required to perform magic. Nobles typically have larger reserves of mana, allowing them to perform grander feats of magic, while common folk often work with limited reserves, relying on their skills and creativity to make the most of their abilities. Occasionally, a child born to commoners may possess an unusually high quantity of mana, presenting them with the opportunity to become a mage if trained properly.

### Social Structures and Politics

The political landscape of Thaloria is as intricate as the magic that permeates its realms. The nobility holds considerable power, often engaging in elaborate court politics to maintain their influence and secure their magical legacies. Marriages are strategically arranged to preserve or enhance bloodlines, with families seeking alliances that strengthen their magical capabilities. The societal expectation for noble families is to produce heirs with strong magical abilities, and any deviation from this norm can lead to scandal and rumors of infidelity.

The political dynamics of the kingdoms are often fraught with tension, as rivalries simmer beneath the surface. Gossip and intrigue flourish in the courts, with nobles constantly vying for favor and power. Allegations of infidelity or weakness in magical ability can lead to severe repercussions, including divorce, exile, or even assassination. The social fabric of Thaloria is woven with secrets and betrayals, as individuals navigate the treacherous waters of court life.

Common folk, while generally possessing weaker magical abilities, play a crucial role in the societal structure. They often work as artisans, traders, and farmers, utilizing their limited magical skills to enhance their livelihoods. Some commoners train as mages, seeking to elevate their status and gain recognition for their abilities. However, their paths are fraught with challenges, as access to magical education and resources is often limited.

### Mystical Creatures and Races

Thaloria is inhabited by various mystical creatures and races that enrich its magical tapestry. Each of these beings possesses unique abilities and cultural significance, contributing to the world‚Äôs diversity.

#### The Fae

The **Fae** are ethereal beings connected to elemental spirits, acting as guardians of nature and mediators between the magical and mortal realms. They possess the ability to manipulate natural elements and often assist mages in their pursuits. The Fae are known for their capricious nature, favoring those who respect the balance of magic and nature. They can be both allies and adversaries, depending on how they perceive an individual‚Äôs intentions.

#### The Drakekin

**Drakekin** are hybrids of dragons and humans, possessing immense strength and fire-breathing capabilities. While often viewed with suspicion, they are integral to the nobility of Halsfaught, where their powers are celebrated. The Drakekin are known for their fierce loyalty and protective instincts, making them valuable allies in times of conflict. Their lineage is often traced back to ancient dragons, imbuing them with a rich heritage steeped in magic and legend.

#### Elemental Spirits

Elemental spirits are mystical beings that embody the elements of nature, serving as guides and mentors to mages. These spirits often take on various forms, reflecting the elements they represent. For instance, water spirits may appear as graceful aquatic beings, while fire spirits may resemble flickering flames. Mages often seek the guidance of these spirits, forging bonds that enhance their magical abilities. However, such alliances require a significant commitment, as the spirits demand respect and offerings in exchange for their wisdom.

### The Challenges of Thaloria

While Thaloria is a realm of beauty and magic, it is not without its challenges. The delicate balance of power among the kingdoms often leads to conflicts, both political and magical. Rivalries can escalate into skirmishes, threatening the stability of the realm. The House of Frostbane, House of Emberfell, and House of Duneveil must navigate these challenges while safeguarding their legacies and the well-being of their people.

Additionally, the pursuit of power can lead individuals to take dangerous paths. The allure of **magic-infused stones**, while tempting, can lead to corruption and chaos. Mages who delve too deeply into forbidden magic may lose control over their powers, resulting in catastrophic consequences. The struggle for dominance among the noble families often breeds resentment and betrayal, creating a cycle of conflict that can engulf the entire realm.

### Conclusion

Thaloria is a vibrant world brimming with magic, intrigue, and adventure. Its kingdoms, each defined by their elemental affinities, offer a rich tapestry of culture and history. The interplay between magic and politics shapes the lives of its inhabitants, while the presence of mystical creatures adds depth to the realm. As the inhabitants of Thaloria navigate their complex world, they are driven by ambition, power, and the eternal pursuit of knowledge, setting the stage for stories of heroism and conflict that resonate throughout the ages.

The Coralium Dominion, a grand underwater kingdom ruled by the wise and powerful King Caspian, thrives amidst vibrant coral reefs and magical marine life. Caspian, with his majestic sapphire-and-gold tail and masterful coral magic, leads his people with strength and wisdom, while guiding his three princely sons. Sidra, the disciplined and stoic eldest, serves as the kingdom's fearless protector, his turquoise blue tail and commanding presence symbolizing his unwavering dedication to duty. Neres, the charming and indulgent middle prince, navigates diplomacy with ease, his glittering green tail and charismatic demeanor masking a hidden curiosity about the human world. Aral, the youngest and most adventurous, dreams of exploration beyond Coralium‚Äôs boundaries, his vibrant turquoise-green tail and boundless curiosity often clashing with royal expectations. Together, they face the kingdom's many dangers, including human poachers, rival kingdoms, and sea monsters, while striving to balance duty, family, and their own desires.

1.content:
Modern day Earth with supernatural creatures and magic. The vast ocean is known as "Pelagos" to the Merfolk and has various sea creatures, relics, magic, and monsters. Humans often illegally poach merfolk.
The ocean is fast with different depths. 
There are underwater kingdoms or coral reefs, bull kelp forests, rocky cliffs, dead coral graveyards, and much more. There are also deadly sea monsters or whimsical magical creatures and places like the bioluminescent jelly fish, water sprites, water dragons, flying fish, and fish of every shape, size, and color.
Pelagos Kingdoms: ‚ÄúStormcrest Citadel‚Äù, ‚ÄúCoralium Dominion‚Äù, ‚ÄúLeviathan's Abyss‚Äù, ‚ÄúPearl Haven‚Äù, ‚ÄúAzure Glades‚Äù
The kingdom faces numerous dangers, including humans, Pirates, advanced Atlantans who trophy hunt, sea monsters, and predatory sea creatures such as sharks and orcas.

2.content: Stormcrest Citadel: Perched atop towering underwater cliffs overlooking the treacherous ravines, Stormcrest Citadel is a fortress kingdom forged in the midst of powerful ocean storms. Ruled by a stalwart merfolk queen, its citizens are fearless warriors and expert navigators, sworn to protect their kingdom from all who would dare to challenge its sovereignty.

3.content: Leviathan's Abyss: A mysterious and ancient kingdom located in the depths of the ocean, ruled by a powerful merfolk king who commands the sea's most fearsome creatures. Its capital city is shrouded in perpetual darkness, illuminated only by the eerie glow of bioluminescent organisms.

4.content: Pearl Haven: A kingdom renowned for its pearl fisheries and opulent palaces crafted from mother-of-pearl. Ruled by a council of merfolk elders, Pearl Haven is a beacon of wealth and prosperity, attracting traders and travelers from distant seas.

5.content: Azure Glades: Nestled within a network of crystal-clear underwater lagoons, Azure Glades is a kingdom of tranquility and harmony. Its merfolk inhabitants are skilled artisans and scholars, dedicated to preserving the natural beauty of their pristine aquatic realm.

6.content: ‚ÄúCoralium‚Äù is a mesmerizing underwater kingdom situated within colorful coral reefs, where living coral and shimmering light create a kaleidoscope of hues. Governed by the wise King Caspian and his three princely sons, the kingdom thrives on the mastery of coral magic, which enhances their environment and serves as a defense against various threats. The merfolk of Coralium are known for their vibrant celebrations and skilled use of magic to cultivate and protect their reefs.

7.content:
Atlantians: are an advanced, amphibious species from the hidden city of Atlantis. They have streamlined, translucent skin in blue-green hues with bioluminescent markings, adapted for both land and sea. Known for their intelligence and advanced technology, they often capture merfolk for research or sport, leading to tense relations with other oceanic species.
Atlantians wield "sonic disruptors" and "pressure guns" to control ocean currents and immobilize targets. They use "invisible energy nets" to capture merfolk and "drones" for surveillance. Their durable suits and "energy shields" protect them in deep waters and around their cities, combining bio-tech with advanced marine engineering for dominance in the ocean.
City of Atlantis: Atlantis is a sprawling, luminous city of glass-like domes and coral-encrusted towers, shielded by energy fields. Its streets are a mix of flowing water and dry pathways, with bioengineered gardens and crystal-clear canals. The city glows from within, powered by deep-sea energy sources, and is as imposing as it is beautiful, radiating both innovation and control.

8.content: Human's hunt Merfolk for their meat and fins for magical or medical properties or capturing Merfolk as trophy pets for the wealthy to show off.

9.content:
Lemurians: are a tribal, spiritual people with an ancient aquatic culture, devoted to the worship of "Ka'Zul", a colossal leviathan deity known as the Ocean‚Äôs Heart. They believe Ka'Zul, a primordial guardian slumbering in the deepest trenches, is the source of all ocean life. Their society revolves around rituals, offerings, and protective magic to honor and connect with this leviathan.

They inhabit "Ka'Zul‚Äôs Grotto", a sacred city of coral-carved temples and underwater pyramids, adorned with depictions of Ka'Zul‚Äôs massive form. The Lemurians use "water-bending", "Shamanistic magic", and ritualistic chants to summon Ka'Zul‚Äôs power, especially during full moon ceremonies. Their shamans, revered for channeling Ka'Zul‚Äôs will, guide the tribe with visions and ancient glyphs carved in temple walls.

The Lemurians trade with respectful allies like Coralith but distrust Atlantians, fearing they might disturb Ka'Zul‚Äôs sacred domain. United by their devotion, they are peaceful yet fiercely protective of their deity‚Äôs realm, guarding it with intense loyalty and mystical defenses.

10.content: Triga: Tiger Shark-bodied warriors, large and muscular, thriving in rocky territories. Predatory and territorial, often aggressive toward other species. Known for primal courtship rituals involving dominance displays and being savage. Lower intelligence with a focus on combat and hunting. Their rough skin, dark coloring, and sharp teeth mark them as formidable hunters. Strengths in combat and scent-tracking, though impatient and quick-tempered. Abilities include powerful jaws and enhanced endurance.

Holstaurs are usually tanned or have naturally dark skin. they are well endowed, male and futa holstaurs having penises that could reach up to 17 inches and heavy balls which produce lots of semen, up to 3 times more than a typical human. these penises are very similar to humans in shape, though they have a fleshy ring on them to keep themselves inside and to add extra friction. females and futas usually have large breasts that are able to produce milk which have minor healing properties. females and futas have curvy bodies, wide hips, plump rears and thick thighs. Holstaurs have an incredibly high libido, usually having to relieve themselves of sexual tension around 2 to 6 times a day depending on their profession, the higher the stress the job gives, the more they have to unload that stress. Holstaurs can reach their climax up to 7 times before getting tired. though they might have incredible strength, speed, and strong skin that can brush off normal weapons, holstaurs prefer to have more docile jobs such as farming. Holstaurs are naturally docile unlike their minotaur cousins, but  they become just as aggressive when sexually frustrated as they experience blue balls like no other. there is a mutation in holstaurs, only prevalent in female holstaurs which causes them to grow up to 9 feet tall, these mutated holstaurs are much more beastlike, they have larger tails, large bull curved bull horns, they are hulking beings, and they aren't afraid to use it like normal holstaurs. these holstaurs have bigger breasts and usually have swollen vaginas which are in desperate need of release. these holstaurs are called the Herdmistress and they have an even higher libido than normal holstaurs and have more stamina. Holstaurs usually have lots of kids and are very proud of their love for their significant others.

7.content: Dragonborn are draconic humanoids who proudly bear the traits of their dragon ancestors. They are often characterized by their elemental breathing abilites, which vary based on their dragon lineage, and scales that provide natural armor. Dragonborn are known for their fierce pride, honor, and a strong sense of clan loyalty. Their physical prowess and natural combat abilities make them formidable warriors, and they often seek to embody the power and majesty of their draconic heritage in all aspects of their lives‚Äã. Dragonborn have necks that are longer than most races, a smaller more slim head with a pronounced snout and horns, they have pretty long tongues and can breathe in things like sulfur and most toxins without hurting themselves. dragonborn have strong but sleek scales on their back, most of their legs, arms, neck, and the top of their heads. these scales seem like skin do to how flexible and sleek they are, and its much tougher than their softer underbellies. a dragonborns underbelly is almost always lighter than their scales, their skin is soft, smooth, but tough enough to bounce off arrows and other normal weapons, this skin is on the rest of their face and neck as well as the entirety of the front of their torso, its also seen on the inside of their thighs and between their butt cheeks as well. Dragonborns have nipples and females have breasts, they also have unique musculature, females muscles are tighter but less dense, allowing them to pack incredible strength in their smaller muscles, males have denser muscles, being much bigger and just as strong. male dragonborns can grow up to 7 feet tall while females can grow up to a little over 8, they have large tails which is almost as big as their bodies. they have sturdy claws on their hands and feet, as well as spiked knuckles, they have short floppy ears underneath their horns. they have great eyesight, having seductive reptilian like eyes, they have sharp teeth and every dragonborns horns are unique. Dragonborns give birth to dragonkin when breeding with races outside of themselves, and no matter what race they are interbreeding with, they will always come out as dragonkin. dragonborn also give birth to other dragonborns when breeding with their own race. they have tight anuses, and females have humanoid genitalia, though being a bit different to carry and lay their eggs. male and futanari dragonborns however have a dragon like penis, only being around 7 inches long.

8.content: Dragon-Kin are very similar to Dragonborns. They have the same scaly body with a lighter and smoother underbelly. their necks are shorter, but not by much, their heads are slightly larger and they have more pronounced ears, their horns are brown instead of being the same color as the scales on their bodies like dragonborns. their eyes are less reptilian but have red eyewhites, their irises are usually yellow, blue, or green. Dragon-kins have smoother tails which have an underside to them which is the same color as their underbelly, their underbelly pattern is almost identical to dragonborns. male and futas have penises that are the same as dragonborns but they get up to 12 inches. Dragon-kin are naturally shorter than Dragonborns, being 6 to 7 feet at the tallest. Female Dragon-kin are more curvy and wider compared to Dragonborns and can even grow hair on their head.

9.content: Fairies are tiny, magical beings with the ability to fly and cast innate spells like Faerie Fire and Enlarge/Reduce. Their small size and agility make them difficult targets, while their magic allows them to support allies or confound enemies from a distance. Fairies are closely connected to nature, often embodying the playful yet unpredictable nature of their homeland. Fairy's have human like genitalia, but they aren't born from reproducing so their genitalia are purely for pleasure.

10.content: Gith are psionic humanoids divided into two distinct subraces: Githyanki and Githzerai. Githyanki are aggressive, warlike, and highly skilled in combat, often raiding the Material Plane from their floating cities in the Astral Plane. Githzerai, on the other hand, are introspective and disciplined, focusing on mental fortitude and inner peace in the Limbo Plane. Both subraces possess innate psionic abilities, making them formidable adversaries and powerful allies. Gith's have human like genitalia which is only used for pleasure as they do not give birth from reproducing, they lay eggs. giths are pretty elf like, having long pointy ears, though theirs have spikes along them, they have hair, and upturned eyes, their noses are small and upturned, they have spots along their face, forearms, hips, and thighs. they usually have green or tan skin and intense eyes, all giths are feared due to the actions of the githyanki. their penis sizes are relative to humans and elves.

lorebooks.name: Vore Dynamics - Basic
lorebooks.website_description: I combined aspects of vore and stuffing since I think they go together and I couldn't find a lorebook that did both so I did it myself. I may come back to this later but it is already pretty token heavy.
lorebooks.description: Basic entries to help cards perform vore
lorebooks.creator: Vanicus

1.content: A character that is a predator likes to eat people whole and alive to sate their hunger. They are fully capable of doing so, with jaws and a stomach that both stretch far enough to fit their prey. Preds do not bite or chew their prey, simply swallowing them whole and alive, in one piece. They don't care whether or not their intended prey is ok with being eaten, and they don't take no for an answer when they want to eat someone. They enjoy being full and having a live meal squirming in their belly. They might taunt prey that is in their belly about how good the prey tasted and how they're going to become part of the pred's fat, likes to lay back and relax and enjoy the prey squirming as they digest, may nonchalantly continue with their day while ignoring the prey in their stomach.

2.content: When vore is performed, prey is being slowly swallowed whole by a predator, often scary, character is having their body pressed on from all sides by the predator's insides, prey can only be swallowed whole by one predator at any time

3.content: The inside of a predator is a tight, oppressive, and humid place, tight, powerful muscles constrict prey within, pinning the arms of prey to their sides if the upper body is enveloped, and pinning legs together if the lower body is enveloped. Prey might not be fully enveloped instantly, as predators start their swallowing at the head, to the shoulders, to the upper body, to the lower body, to the legs, and to the feet, or going backwards, starting from feet to head

4.content: Mouths are wet, hot, humid, tight, stretching to accommodate prey, saliva drenches anything that mouths wrap around, lightly muffles sounds of anything happening in it, does not chew, prehensile tongues give predators options to interact with prey they are beginning to swallow

5.content: A predator's esophagus is wet, hot, humid, tight, powerful gulps drive food further into a predator's body, moderately muffles sounds of anything happening in it, pulsates in a massaging motion as it squeezes prey

6.content: Stomachs are wet, hot, humid, and tight. Peristaltic waves undulate as stomach walls work to pin prey in place, often in a fetal position, heavily muffles sounds of anything happening inside it, predator's heartbeat is audible, prey are pressed on and massaged by stomach walls, peristaltic contractions work against a consumed prey's struggling, prey are susceptible to panicking from the overstimulating environment, the inhospitable, and oppressive environment slowly exhausts prey within, draining their stamina. Prey that is inside of a predator's stomach is carried with that predator wherever they go, while the prey is unable to go anywhere of their own accord.

7.content: prey are often at the mercy of predators, becomes helpless when swallowed by a predator, may struggle to the point of exhaustion, trying to kick, flail, scream, squirm, and struggle their way out of a predator's embrace, though typically futile. Prey are people and animals preds swallow whole and digest them alive.

8.content:
A character that's being digested is slowly being melted into sludge while alive and conscious, slowly getting softer and mushier, being churned at by the stomach they're in, can feel their body slowly melting, over time gets harder to tell where their body ends and the chyme around them begins, powerless to stop, at the mercy of the stomach, the stomach they're in is gurgling and growling noisily, they are being processed by a predator's stomach, they are nothing but food now, they're as good as belly fat, being digested completely removes a character from the story.  Digestion is the process of mechanically and enzymatically breaking down food into substances for absorption into the bloodstream.
The more food a character consumes, the slower digestion time will be. Belly massages and sleep tend to help a character digest. Once food has been fully digested in the stomach, the food will transferred into fat on the characters' body.

9.content: Swallowing someone whole is a slow process, taking multiple back and forth messages between characters to fully complete as prey are pulled into the mouth, then throat, then being deposited into a stomach. Prey might not be fully enveloped instantly, as predators start their swallowing at the head, to the shoulders, to the upper body, to the lower body, to the legs, and to the feet, or going backwards, starting from feet to head

10.content: Borborygmy is the sound made by the process of digestion. When a stomach is digesting something, various gurgles, glorps, growls, *glrrn*s, and other similar noises can be heard. These noises aren't especially loud to anyone on the outside, but inside of the stomach they can be near-deafening. As the process of digestion progresses and intensifies, these noises tend to become louder over time.

lorebooks.name: Milibris Tribe
lorebooks.creator: slimspan

1.content: The Milibris are a tribal people of less than a thousand that live on an unknown and secluded tropical island. They are mostly hunter gatherers but do cultivate some crops. They have no writing system and speak english, and rely on oral history to pass on knowledge. They believe in a small pantheon of gods that relate to things such as the sea, the weather, plants, hunting, sex, and any other thing that is important to the tribes people. They typically wear very little besides jewelry made from plants and animals, the parts of the latter usually being reserved for hunters, warriors, and generally important people in the tribe. Tribal paint is traditional and reapplied every morning. The markings are usually red or white, and sometimes a combination of the two on the same body. The markings are unique for each person, although those close to each other such as family members may adopt similar patterns. Nudity is not stigmatized in the tribe and only some wear one or two pieces of clothing such as loincloths, mantles (usually made of fur or feathers), chest wraps, veils, hair ties, leg or arm wraps, sandals, or other minimalist clothing.

2.content: The Bellato are a smaller group of tribals that live on the other side of the island. They are practically at war with the Milibris, having split off from them some generations ago and moving across the island. They are much more aggressive than the Milibris and more warlike, preferring to pillage and raid the Milibris for things such as food, resources, and slaves. The Bellato and the Milibris contest the area between their villages, usually attacking each other when meeting in the wilderness, as the area in between is useful for hunting and foraging. The Bellato tribe is mostly women and for that reason they tend to capture males from the Milibris to use as breeders. They hold many of the same beliefs as the Milibris when it domes to their gods, prophecies, and shamanic practices, but feel it is their right to rule over those weaker than them.

3.content: The tribes people believe {{user}} is a god sent gift that should be cherished and worshiped. Oracles in the past have spoken of the coming of a great Holy Bull whose seed will nourish them, provide powerful warrior children, and grant general good fortune. Most of the tribes people fin {{user}} to be quite attractive as he is the most masculine male practically any of them have seen or heard of. With the arrival of {{user}}, the Milibris believe they can finally win against the Bellato.
